Therefore the Anandamaya is not the individual self.
  1. MantravarÅ†ikameva ca gÄ«yate Because also that the same Being, who is denoted by the words of the Mantra (in the context), is declared (as the Anandamaya). That same Brahman, who is described by the words of the Mantra, ‘The Brahman is Reality, Knowledge, Infinity’ is spoken of as the Anandamaya in the passage ‘Verily from this’ (Tait. II-1-1). Hence the Anandamaya is not the individual self.
  2. Netaronupapatten He, who is other (than the Brahman) is not (that Being, who is described by the words of the Mantra) because (in such a case) there would be inappropriate - ness. It should not be doubted that the other (individual self) is denoted by the words of the Mantra. The individual self, either in his state of bondage or in the state of final release, cannotm Ã—à«® à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¥ à¤•à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¥ à¤¸à¤¹ à¥¤ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤®à¤£à¤¾ à¤µà¤¿à¤ªà¤¶à¥à¤šà¤¿à¤¤à¤¾" à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤—à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¨à¥‹ à¤¬à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¥¤ à¤®à¥à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤šà¥‡à¤¦à¥ƒà¤¶à¤µà¤¿à¤ªà¤¶à¥à¤šà¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤ªà¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤ƒ à¥¤ à¤¸à¥‹à¤½à¤•à¤¾à¤®à¤¯à¤¤ à¥¤ à¤¬à¤¹à¥ à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤œà¤¾à¤¯à¥‡à¤¯ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤µà¤¿à¤šà¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¿à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤¸à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤° à¤¹à¥à¤­à¤µà¤¨ à¤¸à¤‚à¤•à¤²à¥à¤ªà¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤®à¤¿à¤¦à¤‚ à¤µà¤¿à¤ªà¤¶à¥à¤šà¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¹à¥à¤¯à¥à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤œà¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ à¤®à¥à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤œà¥à¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤ªà¤¿ à¤œà¤—à¤¦à¥à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤ªà¤¾à¤°à¤¾à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¥€à¤¦à¥ƒà¤¶ à¤µà¤¿à¤ªà¤¶à¥à¤šà¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¸à¤‚à¤­à¤µà¤ƒ à¥¥ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¶à¥à¤š - à¤­à¥‡à¤¦à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤šà¥à¤š à¥¥ à¥§à¥® à¥¥ à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¾ à¤à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¤ à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤½à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤° à¤†à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¤®à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤µà¤¿à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤—à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¨à¥‹ à¤­à¥‡à¤¦à¥‡à¤¨à¤¾à¤¯à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¤®à¤¯à¥‹ à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ have such Vipascitiva or extraordinary intellect mentioned in the scriptural text,’ He enjoys all desires and the intelligent Brahman (Tait. II-1-2). It is stated in the subsequent text, ‘It thought, may I become many’ (ChÄnd. VI-2-1 & 3), that the intelligence (Vipascittva) is only in the form of the will of the lord in assuming many forms of wonderful things including movable and immovable beings. Though the liberated soul, is all-knowing, yet he cannot create the world. Hence he cannot have such Vipascittva (intelligence) of the type stated above.
  3. Bhedavyapadesacca Because also there is (in the context ) the declara- tion of difference (between the individual self and the Brahman). That the Anandamaya is distinct from the individual soul known as VijÃ±Änamaya is declared in the Scriptural text, â€˜Different from this VijÃ±Änamaya (the individual soul) is this Inner-self, the Anandamaya ( Tait II-5). It should not à¥¬] à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥©à¥¯ à¤¨ à¤š à¤µà¤¿à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¤¯ à¤µà¤¿à¤·à¤¯à¤¤à¤¯à¥‹à¤¦à¤¾à¤¹à¥ƒà¤¤à¥‡ à¤¶à¥à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¥‡ “à¤µà¤¿à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤‚ à¤¯à¤œà¥à¤à¤‚ à¤¤à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥‡ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤µà¤¿à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¤¯à¥‹ à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤¿à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¶à¤™à¥à¤•à¤¨à¥€à¤¯à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤¯à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤¸à¥‚à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤•à¤¾à¤° à¤à¤µà¥‡ - à¤®à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤¶à¤™à¥à¤•à¤¾à¤‚ à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤¹à¤°à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¤¿ - " à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤šà¥à¤š à¤•à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¤¾à¤‚ à¤¨ à¤šà¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤µà¤¿à¤ªà¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¯à¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¤ " à¤µà¤¿à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤‚ à¤¯à¤œà¥à¤à¤‚ à¤¤à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥‡ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¯à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤•à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¤¾à¤‚ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤•à¤°à¥à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤µà¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡- à¤¶à¤¾à¤šà¥à¤š à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤ƒ à¤•à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¾, à¤µà¤¿à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¥‡à¤¨ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¤ à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤¿à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¥‡ à¤¤à¥ à¤µà¤¿à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¥‡à¤¨à¥‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¥‡à¤¶ à¤µà¤¿à¤ªà¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥, à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¥à¤§à¥‡à¤ƒ à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¥ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¶à¥à¤š - à¤•à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤šà¥à¤š à¤¨à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤ªà¥‡à¤•à¥à¤·à¤¾ à¥¥ à¥§à¥¯ à¥¥ " à¤¸à¥‹à¤½à¤•à¤¾à¤®à¤¯à¤¤ à¥¤ à¤¬à¤¹à¥ à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¥” à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤•à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤œà¤—à¤¤à¥à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤—à¤ƒ " be doubted that the term VijÃ±Änamaya means mere intellect on the ground that the VijÃ±anamaya is mentioned as mere intellect in the text’ VijÃ±Äna (intellect) performs the sacrifice’ (Tait. II-5-1). The SutrakÄra himself will clear this doubt in Sutra II-3-35. In the seriptural text The intellect per- forms the sacrifice (Tait. II-5-1), the word intellect denotes the individual self who is the agent of the sacrifice. If the word, VijÃ±Äna means intellect alone and not the individual self, then the reading of the text would be in a different way; because intellect is only an instrument of action.
  4. Kamacca nanumanapeksa Because also His will (is in itself the cause of creation) the Pradhana is not needed (by Him in the act of creation). That the creation of the world is effected by His will alone is stated in the scriptural statement, He desired may I C à¤œà¤—à¤¤à¤ƒ A 2, M 1, à¥ªà¥¦ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥‚à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤—à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¨à¥‹ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤•à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤šà¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤—à¥‡ à¤†à¤¨à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤ªà¥‡à¤•à¥à¤·à¤¾ à¤¦à¥ƒà¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤—à¤®à¥à¤¯à¤‚ ‘à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¥ à¥¥ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¶à¥à¤š - à¤…à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤š à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤—à¤‚ à¤¶à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¥ à¥¨à¥¦ à¥¥ à¤…à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤¨à¥ à¤†à¤¨à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¤®à¤¯à¥‡ à¤…à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤—à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¨ à¤†à¤¨à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¤¯à¥‹à¤—à¤‚ à¤¶à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¿ " à¤°à¤¸à¥‹ à¤µà¥ˆ à¤¸à¤ƒ à¥¤ à¤°à¤¸à¤‚ à¤¹à¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤µà¤¾à¤¯à¤‚ à¤²à¤¬à¥à¤§à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥€ à¤­à¤µà¤¤à¤¿ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¤ à¤…à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤—à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¨à¥‹- à¤½à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤œà¥à¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¥‹à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤®à¥‹ à¤œà¤—à¤¤à¥à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¤­à¥‚à¤¤ à¤†à¤¨à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¤®à¤¯à¤ƒ à¥¥ become manifold and be born’ (Tait. II-6-1). It is seen that the individual soul requires the Pradhana for the production of something. The Pradhana is Anumana because it is proved by the inferential reasoning.
  5. Asminnasya ca tadyogam s’asti Because also the scripture declares that the indi- vidual self’s acquisition of the bliss takes place when he is in association with this (Anandamaya). " The scriptural text declares that this individual soul gets bliss on reaching Him. The scriptural text is this Bliss, indeed, is He. Having obtained that very same Bliss, he (i.e. the individual self) becomes blissful ( Tait. II- 7-1). There - fore Anandamaya is the all-knowing Highest Person, who is the cause of the world and who is other than the individual self. à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¥ M 1, à¥­] à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥ªà¥§ à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥ à¥­ à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤°à¥à¤®à¥‹à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥¨à¥§ à¥¥ à¤…à¤¯à¤‚ à¤œà¤—à¤¤à¥à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¥‹ à¤µà¤¿à¤ªà¤¶à¥à¤šà¤¿à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¤®à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤•à¤¶à¥à¤šà¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤ªà¤šà¤¿à¤¤à¤ªà¥à¤£à¥à¤¯ à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥‡à¤·à¥‹ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥‡à¤·à¥‹ à¤¦à¥‡à¤¹à¤¯à¥‹à¤—à¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡; à¤¨à¤¾à¤¯à¤‚ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¥‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¨à¤¾à¤¶à¤™à¥à¤•à¤¨à¥€à¤¯à¤®à¥ à¥¤ â€œà¤¯ à¥¤ à¤à¤·à¥‹à¤½à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥‡ à¤¹à¤¿à¤°à¤£à¥à¤®à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¥Œ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥‚à¤¯à¤®à¤¾à¤£à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·: à¤¸ à¤à¤· à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤·à¤¾à¤‚ à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤®à¥€à¤¶à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤·à¤¾à¤‚ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¥ˆà¤µ à¥¤ à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤ƒ ? à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤°à¥à¤®à¥‹à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¤à¥ (C à¤•à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤®à¥ " " à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¨à¤¾à¤® à¥¤ à¤¸ à¤à¤· à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤­à¥à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤®à¤­à¥à¤¯ à¤‰à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ ANTARADHIKARANA 7
  6. Antastaddharmopadesat He, who is within the sun and the eye is the Brahman; because His attributes are declared in the context. ’ It should not be doubted that the Anandamaya, who is the cause of the world, omniscient and blissful is understood to be an individual self endowed with extraordinary merits and not the Supreme Self, because he is said to have a body. It refers to the Supreme Person and the Highest Self, that is denoted by the word, Person, occurring in the scriptural statement The Person, who is seen within the sun, He is brilliant like gold etc.’ (Chand. I-6-6). Why? Because His attributes are declared in the context. The attributes of the Highest Person, who is other than the individual self, are (a) His unlimited Lordship over all the worlds and all the desires (b) His not being under the influence of Karman. The scriptural authorities are- He is the lord of all the worlds 6 à¥ªà¥¨ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: [à¤…à¤§à¤¿â€¢ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤ªà¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤²à¥‹à¤•à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µ à¤•à¤¾à¤®à¥‡à¤¶à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤‚ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¤ à¤à¤µà¤¾à¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¤µà¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤‚ à¤š à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤—à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¨à¥‹ - à¤½à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯ ‘à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¥ˆà¤µ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤§à¤°à¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¥¤ " à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¹à¤®à¥‡à¤¤à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¤‚ à¤®à¤¹à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤®à¥ | à¤†à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤µà¤°à¥à¤£à¤‚ à¤¤à¤®à¤¸à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤¤à¥ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥ à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤—à¥à¤£à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤• à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¨à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥à¤—à¤¤à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¸à¤¾à¤§à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤µà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤‚ à¤š à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿- à¤—à¥à¤£à¤µà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¥ˆà¤µ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥‚à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¦à¤¯à¥‹à¤½à¤ªà¤¿ " à¤¸à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤‚ à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¥ " " à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤œà¥à¤à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥ â€ â€œ " à¤ªà¤°à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¶à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤µà¤¿à¤§à¥ˆà¤µ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥‚à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¤¿à¤•à¥€ à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¬à¤²à¤•à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾ à¤š " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤—à¥à¤£à¤¾ à¤µà¤¿à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾ " à¤†à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤µà¤°à¥à¤£à¤‚ à¤¤à¤®à¤¸à¤ƒ à¥¤ à¤ªà¤°à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤¤à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤µà¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¸à¤¾à¤§à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¶à¥à¤°à¤µà¤£à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¾ à¤š à¤µà¤¿à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ and also of all desires ’’ His name is ’ High’. This same person is risen above all sins’ (Chand. I-6-7). 6 The scriptural text, ‘I know this Great Person of sun-like lustre, who is altogether beyond darkness ’ ( Tait. Ar. III - 13-1 ) states that He has an immaterial form, that is peculiar to Him and that could not be included among the modifica- tions of the Prakrti of Triguna (i.e. Sattva, Rajas, and Tamas ) in the same way as the quality of knowledge. That knowledge, etc. are His attributes is clearly seen in the scriptural texts- (1) The Brahman is the Reality, Knowledge’ (Tait. II-1-1). ( 2 ) ’ He, who knows all and understands all ’ ( Mund. I-1-9 ). (3) His supreme power is declared, as varied and natural as well as His activity with knowledge and strength,’ (Svet. VI- 8). That He has a divine form peculiar to Him- self has been stated in the scriptural text,’ He is of sun-like lustre and altogether beyond darkness’ ( Tait. Ar. III-13-1 ) . Hence He is known to be of that form. 6 1 à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¨ à¤à¤µ à¤¸à¤‚à¤­à¤µà¤¤à¤¿ M 1, M 3. à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¨ à¤à¤µ à¤§à¤°à¥à¤®: A 2.à¥­] à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥ªà¥© à¤¤à¤¦à¥‡à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤•à¥à¤¯à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤¶à¥à¤šà¤¾à¤¹- " à¤¹à¤¿à¤°à¤£à¥à¤®à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¥‹ à¤¦à¥ƒà¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤œà¥à¤à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤ƒ à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥, à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¤•à¤¾à¤®à¥‡à¤¶à¥‹à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤¤à¤¥à¥‹à¤¦à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤ªà¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤®à¤¨à¤¾à¤®à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥à¤•à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾, à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤‚ à¤®à¤¾à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤‚ à¤µà¥‡à¤¤à¤¿ " à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤‚ à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¤•à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤—à¥à¤°à¤¹à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤‚ à¤¤à¤šà¥à¤šà¥‡à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾- à¤®à¥ˆà¤¶à¥à¤µà¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¤¸à¤¨à¥€à¤¯à¤‚ à¤®à¤¤à¤®à¥à¤ªà¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¯, " à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤‚ à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥€à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤ƒà¤•à¤°à¤£- à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤•à¥à¤· à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¤à¥ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¤ à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤–à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¤‚ à¤š à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤®à¤¿à¤¡à¤¾à¤šà¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¯à¥ˆ:- à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤®à¥ | à¤…à¤à¥à¤œà¤¸à¥ˆà¤µ à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤µà¤¸à¥ƒà¤œà¥‹ à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥ à¤¨ à¤šà¤•à¥à¤·à¥à¤·à¤¾ à¤—à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¹à¥à¤¯à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤®à¤¨à¤¸à¤¾ à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤•à¤²à¥à¤®à¤·à¥‡à¤£ à¤¸à¤¾à¤§à¤¨à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤µà¤¤à¤¾ à¤—à¥ƒà¤¹à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ ‘à¤¨ à¤šà¤•à¥à¤·à¥à¤·à¤¾ à¤—à¥ƒà¤¹à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¤¨à¤¾à¤ªà¤¿ à¤µà¤¾à¤šà¤¾ à¤®à¤¨à¤¸à¤¾ à¤¤à¥ à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤¦à¥à¤§à¥‡à¤¨ ’ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤ƒ à¥¤ à¤¨ à¤¹à¥à¤¯à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¾à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤¤à¤¾à¤¯à¤¾ à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤®à¥à¤ªà¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ 1 à¤¨ à¤µà¤¾ à¤®à¤¾à¤¯à¤¾- " ’ The VÄkyakÄra also states thus - The passage The Golden Person is beheld’ (ChÄnd. I-6-6) refers to the Wise and Inner One, because He is described as the Lord of the world and the Lord of desires and also as raised high above evils’. Then in the next sentence ‘His form is artificial and is assumed to bless His devotees because He displays His sovereign power he (the VakyakÄra) introduces for refutation the view that His form must be a phase of effect or it must be illusory. Then (he himself) replies thus-’ His form is indeed beyond the reach of the sense-organs; because it is mentioned to be perceived by Antahkarana (or inner sense.’ Dramiá¸ÄcÄrya has com- mented upon it thus- The form of the creator of the universe is not illusory; it is real and natural. It cannot be apprehended by the eye; but could be apprehended through the mind, which must be free from impurity, by one, who has resorted to a different means of attaining Him’. The scriptural text is this- ’ He is not apprehended by the eye, nor by speech ’ ; ’ but can be known only by a pure mind’ (Munda. III-1-8). It is not taught that gods, who have no real form, have a form ; because the The author of the Vakya, an explanatory treatise on the Chandogyopa. nisad, is Brahmanandin alias Tadka. à¥ªà¥ª à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°à¤ƒ [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. ‘à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¹à¤®à¥‡à¤¤à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¤‚ à¤¯à¤¥à¤¾à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤¿ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤¶à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤®à¤¾à¤¹à¤¾à¤°à¤œà¤¨à¤‚ à¤µà¤¾à¤¸à¤ƒ à¤®à¤¹à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤®à¥ | à¤†à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤µà¤°à¥à¤£à¤®à¥’ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤šà¥à¤š à¤¸à¤¾à¤•à¥à¤·à¤¿à¤£à¤ƒ" à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¤ " à¤¹à¤¿à¤°à¤£à¥à¤®à¤¯ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¸à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤šà¥à¤šà¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤®à¥à¤–à¤µà¤¤à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤š à¤µà¤¾à¤•à¥à¤¯à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤¤à¤šà¥à¤š à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤–à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¤‚ à¤¤à¥ˆà¤°à¥‡à¤µ - " à¤¨ à¤®à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤µà¤¿à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¦à¤¾à¤¯ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¯à¥à¤œà¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡, à¤…à¤¨à¤¾à¤°à¤­à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤¾- à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¨à¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¤¾ à¥¤ à¤…à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤—à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¨à¤¶à¥à¤šà¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¥‹ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤ªà¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤•- à¤µà¤¿à¤ªà¤¶à¥à¤šà¤¿à¤¦à¤¨à¤µà¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤¾à¤¤à¤¿à¤¶à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥‹à¤½à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¸à¤¾à¤§à¤¾à¤°à¤£ à¤¦à¤¿à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¥‹à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤‚ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤® à¤œà¤—à¤¤à¥à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥ˆà¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¤¿à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¤ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¤µà¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤®à¥ || à¤­à¥‡à¤¦à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤šà¥à¤šà¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¥¨à¥¨ à¥¥ ’ , scripture describes things as they are. This is also because in a different context, it is stated about the Universal witness thus–’ The form of this person is like a saffron coloured robe ( Br. II-3-6 ) I know this great Person of sun-like lustre ’ (Tait-Ä€r. III-12-7). This passage also is found in the work VÄkya. The phrase He is the Golden Person is to be explained on the similarity of colour of both, like in the case of the expression ’ moon-face’. Dramida himself, has com - mented upon the passage thus - The affix, mayat, is not used in the sense of modification; because the Self is not pro- duced’. Thus the Vedanta texts determine the Brahman, who is other than the Pradhana and the individual self. He has unlimited omniscience (Vipas’cittva), whose natural characteristic is unsurpassed bliss, who possesses a divine form that is peculiar to Him, and not made of matter He is the Highest Person and the cause of the world. Thus there is not any defect.
  7. Bhedavyapadesaccanyah And He is different (from the sun and the other individual selves) because also there is the declaration of difference (between the Brahman on the one hand and the sun and other individual selves on the other). à¥­] à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥ªà¥« " à¤¯ à¤†à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥‡ à¤¤à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥‹ à¤¯à¤®à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥‹ à¤¨ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦ à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤‚ à¤¯ à¤†à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥‹ à¤¯à¤®à¤¯à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¸ à¤¤ à¤†à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¥à¤¯à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤ à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤§à¤¿à¤¦à¥ˆà¤µà¤¤à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤¯ à¤†à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¨à¤¿ à¤¤à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤·à¥ à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¥‡à¤·à¥ à¤¤à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤§à¤¿à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤·à¥ à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¥‡à¤·à¥ à¤¤à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤§à¤¿à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤·à¥ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¥‡à¤·à¥ à¤¤à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤§à¤¿à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤·à¥ à¤¯à¤œà¥à¤à¥‡à¤·à¥ à¤¤à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤§à¤¿à¤¯à¤œà¥à¤à¤®à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¤¿à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¹à¥à¤®à¤£à¥‡, à¤¸à¥à¤¬à¤¾à¤²à¥‹à¤ªà¤¨à¤¿à¤·à¤¦à¤¿ à¤š " à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥ƒà¤¥à¤¿à¤µà¥€à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥‡ à¤¸à¤‚à¤šà¤°à¤¨à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤°à¤­à¥à¤¯ " à¤¯à¥‹à¤½à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥‡ à¤¸à¤‚à¤šà¤°à¤¨à¥, à¤¯à¥‹à¤½à¤•à¥à¤·à¤°à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥‡ à¤¸à¤‚à¤šà¤°à¤¨à¥, à¤¯à¥‹ à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥‡ à¤¸à¤‚à¤šà¤°à¤¨à¥, à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥à¤ƒ à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤‚ à¤¯à¤‚ à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥à¤°à¥à¤¨ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦, à¤à¤· à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤ªà¤¹à¤¤à¤ªà¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤®à¤¾ à¤¦à¤¿à¤µà¥à¤¯à¥‹ à¤¦à¥‡à¤µ à¤à¤•à¥‹ à¤¨à¤¾à¤°à¤¾à¤¯à¤£à¤ƒ C " The scriptural text, ‘He who dwelling in the sun, is within the sun, whom the sun does not know, whose body is the sun, who internally rules the sun-He is thy Self, internal ruler and immortal, ’ ( MÄdh. Bh. III - 7 - 9 ) proves that He is greater than the gods. That He is above the individual self is stated in the scriptural text, ‘He who dwelling in the individual self etc.’ That, He is above the world, is stated in the scriptural text, He, who dwelling within all the worlds, etc.’ The scriptural text, ‘He, who dwelling within all beings’ proves that He is greater than all beings. That He is above all the Vedas is stated in the scriptural text, He, who dwelling within all the Vedas, etc.’ That He is above all sacrifices is stated in the text, ‘He, who dwelling within all the sacrifices.’ All these texts are found in AntaryÃ¤mi- brÄhmana. The SubÄlopanisad passage, beginning with ’ who is moving within the earth’ and proceeding who is moving within Ayakta, who is moving within Aksara (imperish- able), who is moving within Mytyu ( death), whose body is Má¹›tyu, whom Mrtyu does not know. This is the Internal Self of all beings. This is free from all sins. He is the Divine Lord, He is the one NÄrÄyana’ (SubÄ. VII - 1 ) points 1 à¤à¤· à¤¸à¥‡ A 1. " OC àª¹à«àª‚ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¦à¥‡à¤µ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤²à¥‹à¤•à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤­à¥‚à¤¤ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤µà¥‡à¤¦ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¯à¤œà¥à¤à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¥‹à¤ªà¤°à¤¿ à¤µà¤°à¥à¤¤à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¤à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤šà¥à¤›à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤•- à¤¤à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¦à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¤à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¦à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¿à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¯à¤¾ à¤šà¥ˆà¤­à¥à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤­à¥à¤¯à¥‹ à¤­à¥‡à¤¦à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤šà¥à¤šà¤¾à¤¯à¤®à¤ªà¤¹à¤¤à¤ªà¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤®à¤¾’ à¤¨à¤¾à¤°à¤¾à¤¯à¤£à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤—à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¨à¤¶à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°- à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¥‹ à¤¨à¤¿à¤–à¤¿à¤²à¤œà¤—à¤¦à¥‡à¤•à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¸à¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤†à¤•à¤¾à¤¶à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤‚ à¤š à¥®, à¥¯ à¤†à¤•à¤¾à¤¶à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤²à¥à¤²à¤¿à¤™à¥à¤—à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥¨à¥© à¥¥ à¤…à¤¤ à¤à¤µ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¥¨à¥ª à¥¥ out that He is above all gods, all worlds, all beings, all Vedas, all sacrifices, and all souls. He possesses them as His body. He is their Inner-Self. He is not apprehended by them. He is their controller. Thus he is described as different from all these. Hence it is proved, that NÄrÄyaá¹‡a, who is free from all sins, and who is other than the Pradhana and the individual selves, is the sole cause of the world. AKAS ADHIKARANA 8 AND PRÄ€Å…Ä€DHIKARANA 9
  8. Akasastallingat
  9. Ata eva pranal That which is denoted by the word Ä€kasa, (is the Brahman); because His peculiar characteristics (are mentioned in the context in relation to what is denoted by that word). For the same reason (which has been given in the case of Akasa), He, who is denoted by the word PrÄá¹‡a (also in the context is the Brahman). 1 à¤ªà¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿: M 1. à¥®, à¥¯ ] à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥ªà¥­ " à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤£à¤¿ à¤¹ à¤µà¤¾ à¤‡à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¿ à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤¶à¤¾à¤¦à¥‡à¤µ à¤¸à¤®à¥à¤¤à¥à¤ªà¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¤ à¤†à¤•à¤¾à¤¶à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤‚ à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ " à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤£à¤¿ à¤¹ à¤µà¤¾ à¤‡à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¿ à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¿ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤®à¥‡à¤µà¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤¸à¤‚à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤®à¤­à¥à¤¯à¥à¤œà¥à¤œà¤¿à¤¹à¤¤à¥‡ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¥Œ " à¤¸à¤¦à¥‡à¤µ à¤¸à¥‹à¤®à¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤¦à¤®à¤—à¥à¤° à¤†à¤¸à¥€à¤¤à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¤¾ à¤¸à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤¨ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤œà¤—à¤¤à¥à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤¶à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤¸à¤¹à¤šà¤¾à¤°à¤¿à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤µà¤¾à¤šà¤¿- à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¤¾à¤­à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤‚ à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥‡à¤· à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤£à¤¯à¤¶à¤™à¥à¤•à¤¾à¤¯à¤¾à¤‚ " à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤£à¤¿ à¤¹ à¤µà¤¾ à¤‡à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¿ à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¿ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¸à¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤µà¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¥‹’ à¤œà¤—à¤¤à¥à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤²à¤¿à¤™à¥à¤—à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤¶à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤¾à¤­à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°- à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤· à¤à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤¶à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿ’ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¨à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤šà¥€à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ Consider the texts, ‘All these beings are, indeed, born out of the Ä€kÄsa; they go unto the Akasa at the end’. (ChÄnd. 1-9-1). All these beings, indeed, enter into the PrÄna and are evolved out of the PrÄna’ (ChÄnd. I - 11-5). C ’ The doubt, that arises here, is this :- These passages distinctly specify with the terms AkÄsa and PrÄá¹‡a, the universal cause mentioned in the text ‘Existence alone, my dear boy, was in the beginning’ with general term Sat. Here the terms Akasa and Prana denote the popular ether (one of the five elements) and Jiva functioning with co-operation of vital breath of air. The doubt is cleared thus-In the texts quoted above the words Ha vai (indeed) point out that the reason for accepting the object as the universal cause is well-known. Therefore the cause denoted by the terms Ä€kÄsa and PrÄÅ†a must be the Highest Person who is distinct from the popular ether and vital air. Here what is well known is this-The Highest Person is the cause of the world. He became many as a result of His will. He possesses unsurpassed bliss. He grants bliss to the self. à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ M 1, 2, 1 à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤¶à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤¸à¤¹à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤¿ A1. à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¤¾à¤­à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤‚ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿ: A 1, M 3.à¥ªà¥® - à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°à¤ƒ [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. ‘à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¸à¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤¿à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥ â€“ à¤¬à¤¹à¥à¤­à¤µà¤¨ à¤¸à¤‚à¤•à¤²à¥à¤ªà¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¥‡à¤•à¥à¤·à¤£à¤¾à¤¨à¤µà¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤¾à¤¤à¤¿à¤¶à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤¾- à¤¨à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¤¹à¥‡à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤µà¤¿à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¤¯ à¤µà¤¿à¤²à¤•à¥à¤·à¤£à¤¤à¥à¤µ à¤¨à¤¿à¤–à¤¿à¤²à¤­à¥à¤µà¤¨à¤­à¤¯à¤¾à¤­à¤¯à¤¹à¥‡à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤²à¥‹à¤• à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µ à¤•à¤¾à¤®à¥‡à¤¶ - à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤ªà¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤®à¥‹à¤¦à¤¯à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¸à¤¾à¤§à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤°à¤µà¤¿à¤•à¤° à¤µà¤¿à¤•à¤¸à¤¿à¤¤à¤ªà¥à¤£à¥à¤¡à¤°à¥€à¤•- à¤¨à¤¯à¤¨à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤œà¥à¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¸à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¸à¤‚à¤•à¤²à¥à¤ªà¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤ªà¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤ªà¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¥ˆà¤µ à¤¨à¤¿à¤–à¤¿à¤² - à¤œà¤—à¤¦à¥‡à¤•à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¸ à¤à¤µà¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤¶à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¤¾à¤­à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤‚ à¤œà¤—à¤¤à¥à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤˜à¥€à¤¯à¤¤ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¨à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤šà¤¯à¥‹ à¤¯à¥à¤•à¥à¤¤ à¤à¤µ à¥¥ à¤œà¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤¤à¤¿à¤°à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥ à¥§à¥¦ à¤œà¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤¤à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤šà¤°à¤£à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥¨à¥« à¥¥ " à¤…à¤¥ à¤¯à¤¦à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¥‹ à¤¦à¤¿à¤µà¥‹ à¤œà¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤¤à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¥€à¤ªà¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤µà¤¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤ à¥‡à¤·à¥ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¤à¤ƒ He is other than the VijÃ±Änamaya (the individual self). He causes fear and non-fear to the whole world. He is the Lord of all worlds. He is the Lord of all desires. He is free from all evils. He possesses a divine form, that is peculiar to Him. His eyes resemble the lotus, that blossoms forth, when it is in contact with the rays of the sun. He is all- knowing and He possesses a true will. He is the Lord of the Lord of sense-organs. Therefore, it is right to conclude that the words, Akasa and Prana refer to Him as the cause of the world. JYOTIRADHIKARANA 10
  10. Jyotiscaranabhidhanat That which is denoted by the word, Jyotis, (is the Brahman); because there is mention of ( His) feet (in the connected context). It is revealed in the scriptures to the effect-’ Now that light which shines beyond this Heaven, on the backs of all à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¸à¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤¿à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥ A 1, à¥§à¥¦] à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥ªà¥¯ à¤ªà¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤ à¥‡à¤·à¥à¤µà¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤®à¥‡à¤·à¥‚à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤®à¥‡à¤·à¥ à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¥‡à¤·à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¦à¤‚ à¤µà¤¾à¤µ à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¦à¤¿à¤¦à¤®à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¥‡ à¤œà¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤¤à¤¿à¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤ªà¤°à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¤à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¸à¤•à¤²à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤œà¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤¤à¤¿à¤·à¤ƒ à¤•à¥Œà¤•à¥à¤·à¥‡à¤¯- à¤œà¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤¤à¤¿à¤·à¥ˆà¤•à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤µà¤¾à¤•à¥à¤¯à¥‡ ’ à¤µà¤¿à¤°à¥‹à¤§à¤¿à¤²à¤¿à¤™à¥à¤—à¤¾à¤¦à¤°à¥à¤¶à¤¨à¤¾à¤š à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¸à¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤®à¥‡à¤µ à¤œà¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤¤à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤œà¤—à¤¤à¥à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¤¿à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¤ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¶à¤™à¥à¤•à¤¾à¤¯à¤¾à¤‚ à¤¯à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¿ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤µà¤¾à¤•à¥à¤¯à¥‡ à¤µà¤¿à¤°à¥‹à¤§à¤¿ à¤²à¤¿à¤™à¥à¤—à¤‚ à¤¨ à¤¦à¥ƒà¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡; à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾à¤ªà¤¿ à¤ªà¥‚à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤¨à¥ à¤µà¤¾à¤•à¥à¤¯à¥‡ " à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¥‹à¤½à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤µà¤¾ à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¿ à¥¤ à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¤‚ à¤¦à¤¿à¤µà¤¿ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¤¿à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤šà¤°à¤£à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¥ˆà¤µ à¤˜à¥à¤¸à¤‚à¤¬à¤¨à¥à¤§à¤¿à¤¤à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ªà¤¿ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤­à¤¿à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤¸ à¤à¤µ à¤œà¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤¤à¤¿à¤ƒ à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¥‡à¤¨ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤ªà¤°à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨ à¤¸à¤•à¤²à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¤¤à¤¯à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤§à¥€à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ à¤…à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤š à¤•à¥Œà¤•à¥à¤·à¥‡à¤¯à¤œà¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤¤à¤¿à¤·à¥ˆà¤•à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤‚ à¤«à¤²à¤¾à¤¯à¥‹à¤ªà¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¨ à¤•à¤¶à¥à¤šà¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤°à¥‹à¤§à¤ƒ à¥¤ à¤…à¤–à¤¿à¤²à¤œà¤—à¤¦à¥‡à¤•à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤®- the things, on the backs of everything, in the highest worlds. than which there is no higher, that is that same as this light, indeed, which is here within the Person (ChÄnd. III-13-7 ) . Here the following doubt arises - The word, Jyotis (light ), is to be taken as the cause of the creation, etc. of the world; because it is denoted as Higher than all objects. It is also taught to be the same as digestive heat in the stomach. In this passage nothing is seen to prove contradiction with the supposition. Therefore, the popular Jyotis ( light), alone is to be taken as the cause of the creation, etc. of the world. 6 If it be so doubted, the reply is this-It is true that in this passage nothing is seen to prove contradiction with the supposition. Yet, in the same context, the passage - All beings make up His one foot; His three feet represent the immortal beings in the Highest Heaven’ (Chand. III-12-6) occurs wherein all beings are declared to form the foot of this Highest Person who is in relation to the ’ à¤µà¤¿à¤°à¥‹à¤§ A 1, 2. 7 à¥«à¥¦ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°à¤ƒ [ à¤…à¤§à¤¿. gaqsagata1a1a1ufgsqani fesuzqeanu: quaÄ±zda gfa arda farfanuzifaÅ­Ã¬nÄ… sÃ¹Ã¬fa:qszifuÃ¨uza faxa: qÃ²g ada: qÃ²ca- à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤®à¥‡à¤·à¥‚à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤®à¥‡à¤·à¥ à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¥‡à¤·à¥à¤µà¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¥‡à¤·à¥’ à¤µà¤¾à¤¸à¤¶à¥à¤š à¤¯à¥à¤œà¥à¤¯à¤¤ à¤à¤µ || à¤›à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥‹à¤½à¤­à¤¿à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¥‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¨ à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾ à¤šà¥‡à¤¤à¥‹à¤½à¤°à¥à¤ªà¤£à¤¨à¤¿à¤—à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾ fe aziam || 26 || Highest Heaven. The same Person is recognized here. Hence the word, Jyotis, refers to Him, as the cause of the creation, etc. of the world and as higher than all objects. And, in the teaching that this Jyotis is one with the digestive heat of the stomach, there is nothing wrong; because the oneness is enjoined for the purpose of meditation for attaining the desired result. The Highest Person is the only cause of the world. He possesses an extraordinary devine colour, that is peculiar to Him and not a modification of the Praká¹›ti. He possesses a divine form. He is beyond darkness (i.e. PrÄká¹›ta world). He has unsurpassed lustre. Hence it is right to say that He who is denoted by the word Jyotis, lives on the back of all the worlds, on the back of everything and also in all the higher worlds than which there is no higher.
  11. Chandobhidhananneti cenna tatha cetorpaá¹‡aniga- mat; tathahi darsanam If it be said that on account of the metre (Gayatri) being mentioned (in the context, the light or Jyotis mentioned above is) not the Brahman; it is not right to say so; because the teaching here relates. to the concentration of the mind on the Brahman conceived as that same Gayatri; indeed the scripture declares it accordingly. 1 à¤…à¤°à¤¾à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¥‡à¤·à¥ omitted A 1, M 2, 3. à¥§à¥¦] à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥«à¥§ à¤ªà¥‚à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¤à¥à¤°’ " à¤—à¤¾à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥€ à¤µà¤¾ à¤‡à¤¦à¤‚ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤®à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤—à¤¾à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤–à¥à¤¯à¤‚ à¤›à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¤à¥; à¤¨à¥ˆà¤¤à¤¤à¥ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¥ˆà¤µ à¤—à¤¾à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥€ à¤¸à¤¾à¤¦à¥ƒà¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¸à¤‚à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¥‹à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¤à¥, à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤›à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥‹à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤•à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤ª- à¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤°à¥‡à¤µà¥‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¨à¤¿à¤—à¤®à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ªà¤¿ à¤¹à¥à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤›à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤¾à¤¦à¥ƒà¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤›à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥‹à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¥‹ à¤¦à¥ƒà¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ - " à¤¤à¥‡ à¤µà¤¾ à¤à¤¤à¥‡ à¤ªà¤à¥à¤šà¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¥‡ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤°à¤­à¥à¤¯ " à¤¸à¥ˆà¤·à¤¾ à¤µà¤¿à¤°à¤¾à¤Ÿà¥ â€ à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¥Œ || à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¥‹à¤ªà¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤¶à¥à¤šà¥ˆà¤µà¤®à¥ à¥¥ à¥¨à¥­ à¥¥ " In a former passage in the same context, the metre known as the Gayatri is mentioned in the statement ‘The Gayatri, indeed, is all this’ (Chand. III-12-1). Therefore. the Highest Person should not be taken to have been meant in the passages quoted above. To this question we say This is not SO. It is taught there that the Highest Person is to be meditated upon as similar to Gayatri. The conclusion is that it is impossible for that which is merely a metre to be in the form of all beings. Elsewhere, also a word, which ordinarily denotes a metre, is used to denote other thing in consequence of its similarity with it. Vide the passage beginning with- Now these five and the other five’ and ending with ’ this same is virÄj’ (ChÄnd. IV-3-8).
  12. Bhutadipadavyapadesopapattes’caivam Because also it is appropriate only thus to declare that (intelligent) beings and other objects form the feet ( of the Gayatri ). 1 à¤ªà¥‚à¤°à¥à¤µà¤®à¥ M 2. ’ à¤‰à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥ A 1. The metre, Gayatri is said to consist of four quarters of six syllables in each. à¥«à¥¨ à¤µà¥ˆà¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°à¤ƒ [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤ªà¥ƒà¤¥à¤¿à¤µà¥€à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤° à¤¹à¥ƒà¤¦à¤¯à¥ˆà¤¶à¥à¤šà¤¤à¥à¤·à¥à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¶à¥à¤š à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¥‡ à¤—à¤¾à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥€à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦- à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¥‡ à¤¹à¥à¤¯à¥à¤ªà¤ªà¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¤ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¥‚à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‹à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤•à¤¾à¤° à¤à¤µ à¤¸à¤®à¤à¥à¤œà¤¸à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¤‰à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤­à¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¥‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¥‹à¤­à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤ªà¥à¤¯à¤µà¤¿à¤°à¥‹à¤§à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥¨à¥® à¥¥ à¤ªà¥‚à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¤à¥à¤° " à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¤‚ à¤¦à¤¿à¤µà¤¿ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¥‹ à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ à¤…à¤¥ à¤¯à¤¦à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¥‹ à¤¦à¤¿à¤µà¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¤à¥à¤šà¤®à¥à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¦à¥à¤¯à¥à¤¸à¤‚à¤¬à¤¨à¥à¤§à¤¿ à¤œà¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤¤à¤¿ - à¤°à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¨ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤­à¤¿à¤œà¥à¤à¥‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¤à¥; à¤¨à¥ˆà¤¤à¤¤à¥ à¤‰à¤­à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤ªà¤¿ ‘à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¥‡ à¤µà¤¿à¤°à¥‹à¤§à¤¾à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥ ; à¤…à¤¤à¥à¤° à¥¤ The declaration that it has four feet namely the beings, the earth, the body and the heart is appropriate only in relation to the Highest Person who is here denoted by the word, Gayatri. Therefore the above mentioned interpretation alone is right.
  13. Upades’abhedanneti cennobhayasminnapyavirodhat If it be said that, on account of there being a difference between the teachings (given in the context, what is denoted by the word Jyotis) is not the Brahman; it cannot be right to say so; because even in both those teachings there is nothing that is contradictory of each other. In a former passage in the same context, namely, ‘His three immortal feet are in the Highest Heaven’ (Chand. III-12-6), the Highest Person has been pointed out clearly. Here in the scriptural text, ‘That jyotis which is beyond the Highest Heaven’ (Chand. III-13-7), what is denoted by the oblative case is the light that is related to the Highest Heaven. Hence what is described in the former passage cannot be recognised in this subsequent passage. It is not so; 1 à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤µà¤¿à¤°à¥‹à¤§à¤¾à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥ A 1, 2.à¥§à¥§] à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥«à¥© à¤¯à¤¥à¤¾ à¤µà¥ƒà¤•à¥à¤·à¤¾à¤—à¥à¤°à¥‡ à¤¶à¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤¨à¤ƒ, à¤µà¥ƒà¤•à¥à¤·à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤ªà¤°à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤¶à¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤¨ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤ƒ à¥¤ à¤…à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤¦à¤¿à¤µà¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤¤à¥à¤µ- à¤®à¥‡à¤µà¥‹à¤­à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤µà¤¿à¤µà¤•à¥à¤·à¤¿à¤¤à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¤‡à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥ à¥§à¥§ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤—à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥¨à¥¯ à¥¥ à¤†à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¨à¤¾à¤‚ à¤¹à¤¿à¤¤à¤¤à¤®à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤®à¥‹à¤•à¥à¤·à¤¸à¤¾à¤§à¤¨à¥‹à¤ªà¤¾à¤¸à¤¨à¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¤¤à¤¯à¤¾ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¤à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤­à¤¾à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¯à¥‡- à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¸à¥à¤¯ ’ " à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¥‹à¤½à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾ à¥¤ à¤¤à¤‚ à¤®à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤¯à¥à¤°à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥à¤ªà¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¸à¥à¤µ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤µà¤¿à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤¸ à¤à¤µ à¤œà¤—à¤¤à¥à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥ à¥¤ ‘à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¥‹à¤ªà¤¾à¤¸à¤¨à¤‚ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤®à¥‹à¤•à¥à¤·à¤¸à¤¾à¤§à¤¨à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¥¤ because there is nothing contradicory in the two statements. For an analogous example there is this instance- The hawk is on the top of the tree’ and ‘The hawk is above the top. of the tree’. Therefore the purport in both the passages is that He is beyond the Highest Heaven. INDRAPRANADHIKARAÅ…A 11
  14. PraÅ†astathÄnugamat That which is denoted by the word Prana (is the Brahman); because it is understood in the context. The scriptural text is this:-‘Indeed, I am the PrÄá¹‡a and the omniscient self; worship and meditate on me as life and immortality" (Kaus. III-2). The doubt that arises. here is this-The above mentioned text teaches that Indra who is known as JÄ«va (individual soul), is the object of man’s meditation which would give him the Moká¹£a, most beneficial one. He (Indra ) alone is the cause of the world; because the meditation on universal cause alone is the means of Moká¹£a. The scriptural text in support of this is this-
  • à¤œà¤—à¤¤à¥à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¥‹ A 1. à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¯ M 2, 3. à¥«à¥ª à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°à¤ƒ [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¤à¤¾à¤µà¤¦à¥‡à¤µ à¤šà¤¿à¤°à¤‚ à¤¯à¤¾à¤µà¤¨à¥à¤¨ à¤µà¤¿à¤®à¥‹à¤•à¥à¤·à¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤½à¤¥ à¤¸à¤‚à¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¥‡ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤°à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¨à¤¾à¤¶à¤™à¥à¤•- à¤¨à¥€à¤¯à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¤¸à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¥‹ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤­à¥‚à¤¤ à¤‰à¤•à¥à¤¤- à¤²à¤•à¥à¤·à¤£à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¥ˆà¤µ à¥¤ à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤ƒ ? à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤—à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¸à¤¾à¤§à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¤¾à¤¨à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¤¾à¤œà¤°à¤¾- à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤—à¤®à¥‹ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤¦à¥ƒà¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ " à¤¸ à¤à¤· à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£ à¤à¤µ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥‹à¤½à¤œà¤°à¥‹à¤½à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¥ à¤¨ à¤µà¤•à¥à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¥‹à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¦à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¸à¤‚à¤¬à¤¨à¥à¤§à¤­à¥‚à¤®à¤¾ à¤¹à¥à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤¨à¥ à¥¥ à¥©à¥¦ à¥¥ ‘So long as he is not freed from the body, so long there is delay ; then he will reach the Brahman ’ (ChÄnd. VI- 14-2). To this doubt, the reply is this-This Being, who is denoted by the word, Indra mentioned in grammatical equation with the word Prana is the Highest Self characterised above and other than the individual Self. Why? Because it is so understood in the sequal. The particular character- istics of the Highest Self, such as Ananda (bliss ), Ajara ( undecaying ) and Amyta ( immortal) are found in the Being, who is denoted by the words, Indra and PrÄÅ†a. This is mentioned in the scriptural passage, ‘That same PrÄÅ†a is the omniscient self who is bliss, undecaying and immortal’ (Kaus. III-9).
  1. Na vakturÄtmopadesaditi cedadhyatmasam- bhandhabhuma hyasmin If it be said that on account of the speaker Indra declaring himself (to be the sujbect of worship) what is denoted by the words, Indra and PraÅ†a ) is not (the Brahman; it is replied that it cannot be right to say so); because there is here the mention of a multitude of attributes belonging to the Self. à¥§à¥§] à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥«à¥« à¤‰à¤ªà¤•à¥à¤°à¤®à¥‡ " à¤®à¤¾à¤®à¥‡à¤µ à¤µà¤¿à¤œà¤¾à¤¨à¥€à¤¹à¤¿ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¥à¤°à¤µà¤§à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¤¾ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¤à¤œà¥€à¤µ- à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤ªà¤¸à¤‚à¤¹à¤¾à¤°à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¦à¤¨à¥à¤—à¥à¤£à¥‹ à¤µà¤°à¥à¤£à¤¨à¥€à¤¯ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¤à¥; à¤¨à¥ˆà¤¤à¤¤à¥ ; à¤…à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾- à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¸à¤‚à¤¬à¤¨à¥à¤§à¤­à¥‚à¤®à¤¾ à¤¹à¥à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤¨à¥ à¥¤ à¤…à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤®à¥; à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤§à¤°à¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¥¤ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¸à¤‚à¤¬à¤¨à¥à¤§à¤¬à¤¹à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µ- à¤®à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¿à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤§à¥‡à¤¯à¥‡ à¤µà¤¾à¤•à¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤ªà¤•à¥à¤°à¤® à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤­à¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤ªà¤¸à¤‚à¤¹à¤¾à¤°à¤¾à¤¦à¥ à¤¦à¥ƒà¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ “à¤¯à¤‚ à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤‚ à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤·à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯ à¤¹à¤¿à¤¤à¤¤à¤®à¤‚ à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤¸à¥‡ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¹à¤¿à¤¤à¤¤à¤®à¥‹à¤ªà¤¾à¤¸à¤¨à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤°à¤¬à¥à¤§à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤¤à¤šà¥à¤š à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®- à¤§à¤°à¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¥¤ " à¤¤à¤®à¥‡à¤µà¤‚ à¤µà¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤ à¤‡à¤¹ à¤­à¤µà¤¤à¤¿ à¥¤ à¤¨à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¨à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤ƒ à¥¤ à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾ " à¤à¤· à¤à¤µ à¤¸à¤¾à¤§à¥ à¤•à¤°à¥à¤® à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤¯à¤¤à¤¿” à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¤¾ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤¯à¤¿à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤µà¤®à¥, In the beginning of the topic there is the statement, ’ Know me alone’ (Kaus. III - 1 ). Here Indra is denoted as an individual self; because there are statements of attributes such as killing Vá¹›tra, etc.’ The conclusion should also be in consonance with this statement. This is not " because there is in the context the mention of a multitude of attributes belonging to the Self. The phrase the attributes belonging to the self’ means the attributes of the Highest Self’. From the beginning to the end of the sentence, it is seen that he who is denoted by the word, Indra, possesses many attributes belonging to the Highest self. The scriptural statements made in the outset, namely, â€˜You yourself choose for me that boon, which you think most. beneficial to man’ (Kaus. III-1 ) starts with the worship, that is most beneficial to man. That this worship is of the Highest Self is proved in the text, ‘Thus knowing Him one becomes immortal here. There is no other path" (PuruÅŸa Sukta 20 ). Similarly, the Supreme Self is the impeller of all activities, in accordance with the passage He Himself induces him to do good work whom He wishes to lead beyond these worlds, etc." (Kaus. III-8). So also He is the support à¥«à¥¬ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. " à¤à¤µà¤®à¥‡à¤µà¥ˆà¤¤à¤¾ à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤°à¤­à¥à¤¯ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¥‡à¤·à¥à¤µà¤°à¥à¤ªà¤¿à¤¤à¤¾à¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤§à¤¾à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤®à¥ ; à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¤¾à¤¦à¤¯à¤¶à¥à¤š à¥¤ " à¤à¤· à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤ªà¤¤à¤¿à¤ƒ " à¤à¤· à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤ªà¤¤à¤¿à¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¤¾ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‡- à¤¶à¥à¤µà¤°à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤‚ à¤š à¥¥ à¤¶à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¦à¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¥à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¤à¥‚à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¥‹ à¤µà¤¾à¤®à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤µà¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥©à¥§ à¥¥ à¤¨à¤¾à¤®à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤µà¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¥ˆà¤ƒ à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¥ˆà¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¥ˆà¤µà¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤§à¥€à¤¯à¤¤ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¦à¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¥à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¤à¤œà¥à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤ªà¤¨à¤¾à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¤®à¤¿à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¥‡à¤¨ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¥‹à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤ƒ à¥¤ à¤¶à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¾ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤µà¤¾à¤®à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤¾- à¤¦à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¥à¥ˆà¤µ à¤µà¤¦à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ " à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤µà¥ˆà¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤ªà¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¨à¥ à¤‹à¤·à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤®à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¤¿à¤ªà¥‡à¤¦à¥‡ à¤…à¤¹à¤‚ à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤°à¤­à¤µà¤‚ à¤¸à¥‚à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¶à¥à¤š" à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿ à¥¥ of all, in accordance with the passage’ ‘These subtle elements of beings are fixed on the elements of intelligence, and the elements of intelligence are fixed on the Prana’ Kaus. III-8). In the same way are stated the bliss and other attributes. That He is the Lord of all is proved by the statements, ’ He is the Lord of all the worlds’ (Kaus. III-8).
  2. Sastradá¹›á¹£á¹­ya tupadeso vamadevavat And the teaching in the context is, in accordance with the view found in the scripture, as in the case of Vamadeva. All the words denote the Highest Self; because the scriptures state that He transforms Himself into a gross being having name and form. In order to make one remember this, the Highest Self is mentioned here by the word, Indra. VÄmadeva and others whe realised this truth of the scriptures state accordingly. Vide ‘After seeing this, the sage Vamadeva experienced-I have become Manu and the sun etc.’ (Brh. I-4-10), à¥§à¥§] à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥«à¥­ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤®à¥à¤–à¥à¤¯à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤²à¤¿à¤™à¥à¤—à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¥‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¥‹à¤ªà¤¾à¤¸à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥ˆà¤µà¤¿à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¾à¤¶à¥à¤°à¤¿- à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¹ à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤—à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥©à¥¨ à¥¥ à¤¤à¤¾à¤µà¤¦à¤¾à¤¯à¥à¤ƒ " à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¶à¥€à¤°à¥à¤·à¤¾à¤£à¤‚ à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¥à¤°à¤®à¤¹à¤¨à¤®à¥ " " " à¤¯à¤¾à¤µà¤¦à¥à¤§à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤¨à¥ à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¥‹ à¤µà¤¸à¤¤à¤¿ à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤²à¤¿à¤™à¥à¤—à¤‚ à¤®à¥à¤–à¥à¤¯à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤²à¤¿à¤™à¥à¤—à¤‚ à¤šà¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤¨à¥ à¤¦à¥ƒà¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¨à¥ˆà¤µà¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¨; à¤‰à¤ªà¤¾à¤¸à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥ˆà¤µà¤¿à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤§à¥‡à¤¤à¥‹à¤°à¥à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¥‡à¤¨ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¥‡à¤¨ à¤š à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®- à¤¨à¥‹à¤½à¤­à¤¿à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ªà¤¿ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¨à¤ƒ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¥‡à¤£, à¤­à¥‹à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤•à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨,
  3. Jrvamukhyapranalinganneti cennopasa- traividhyadasritatvadiha tadyogat If it be said, that on account of the characteristics of the individual self and of the principal vital air being mentioned in the context, there is no reference to the Brahman here at all, it is replied that it cannot be (right to say) so; because the worship of the Brahman has a three-fold nature; because this three-fold nature of His worship is taken for granted; and because here (ie. in the present context also) that (same kind of worship) may be appropriately referred to. C The characteristics of the individual self are mentioned in the scriptural texts - I killed the three-headed TvÄstra. ’ (Kaus. III-1 ). In the same text are given the characteristics of the vital wind As long as the Prana dwells in this body, so long surely there is life’ (Kaus. I1I-2). Therefore it is presumed that the Brahman is not meant here. It is not so. The words referring to the individual self and Prana denote the Highest Self; because the worship of the Brahman has a three-fold nature. In another context also it is meant to serve the object of teaching of 8à¥«à¥® à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. à¤­à¥‹à¤—à¥à¤¯à¤­à¥‹à¤—à¥‹à¤ªà¤•à¤°à¤£à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤•à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨à¥‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤µà¤¿à¤§à¤®à¥à¤ªà¤¾à¤¸à¤¨à¤®à¤¾à¤¶à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¤à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤¯à¤¥à¤¾ à¥¤ " à¤¸à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤‚ à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¤¨à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤‚ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤®" à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¥‡à¤£, à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¥‡à¤£, " à¤¤à¤¦à¤¨à¥à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤¯ à¥¤ à¤¸à¤šà¥à¤š à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤šà¥à¤šà¤¾à¤­à¤µà¤¤à¥ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿ â€œ à¤¸à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤‚ à¤šà¤¾à¤¨à¥ƒà¤¤à¤‚ à¤š à¤¸à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤®à¤­à¤µà¤¤à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤­à¥‹à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤•à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨ à¤­à¥‹à¤—à¥à¤¯à¤­à¥‹à¤—à¥‹à¤ªà¤•à¤°à¤£à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤•à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨ à¤š à¥¤ à¤‡à¤¹à¤¾à¤ªà¤¿ à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤¸à¤‚à¤­à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤®à¥à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤ƒ à¥¤ " à¤œà¤¨à¥à¤®à¤¾- à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¯à¤¤à¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥ à¤¸à¤¦à¥à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¥‡à¤¤à¤¿à¤¸à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¥ˆà¤°à¥à¤¹à¤¿ à¤œà¤—à¤¤à¥à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¿- à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¤¾à¤­à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¸à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤¤à¤®à¥ à¥¤ " à¤œà¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤¤à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤šà¤°à¤£à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤¨à¥ à¤¸à¥‚à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¤¸à¥‚à¤•à¥à¤¤à¥‹à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¥‹ à¤®à¤¹à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¥‹ à¤œà¤—à¤¤à¥à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥‡à¤·à¤¤à¥‹ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤£à¥€à¤¤à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤¸ 1 C the three kinds of meditation in relation to the Highest Self, namely, the meditation of the Highest Self in His own essential nature, in His having the enjoyers or the individual selves for His body and having the enjoyable things and the auxiliary things of enjoyment for His body. In the following passage, namely, The Brahman is True, Knowledge and Infinite’ (Tait. II-1), the meditation of the Brahman in His own essential nature is taken for granted. In the following passages, Having entered it, He became the Sat and the tyat’ and ‘while being the unchangeable one ( Satya) and the changeable one, He has nevertheless remained true to His own nature’ (Tait. II-6 ), the meditation of the Highest Self as having the enjoyers for His body and also as having the enjoyable things and the auxiliaries of enjoyment for His body is taken for granted. In the present context also, this three-fold meditation of the Highest Self is mentioned as it is appropriate. In the Sutra I - 1-2, the cause of the world, that is denoted by the words, Existence, Brahman and the Self is proved to be the Person other than the individual selves and Prakrti. In the Sutra I-1-25, the cause of the world has been specifically determined to be the Highest Person à¥§à¥§] à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥«à¥¯ à¤à¤µ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¤à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤µà¤¾à¤šà¤¿à¤­à¤¿à¤°à¤¿à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¥ˆà¤°à¤ªà¤¿ à¤•à¥à¤µà¤šà¤¿à¤¤à¥ à¤•à¥à¤µà¤šà¤¿à¤šà¥à¤›à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¦à¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¥à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤šà¥à¤›- à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤•à¤¤à¤¯à¤¾ à¤šà¥‹à¤ªà¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¯à¥‹à¤ªà¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ " à¤¶à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¦à¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¥à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¤à¥‚à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¥‹ à¤µà¤¾à¤®à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤µà¤¤à¥ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ " à¤‰à¤ªà¤¾à¤¸à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥ˆà¤µà¤¿à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤š à¤¸à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤¤à¤®à¥ à¥¥ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥€à¤­à¤—à¤µà¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤œ à¤µà¤¿à¤°à¤šà¤¿à¤¤à¥‡ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾- à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥¤ described in the Puruá¹£asukta. He Himself is denoted by the words Indra etc. which are known to denote the individual selves primarily, because He has to be worshipped with the body of those things in accordance with the scriptures. This fact has been established in SÅ«tras I-1-31 and 32. THUS ENDS THE 1ST PÄ€DA OF THE 1ST ADHYÄ€YA.

à¥¨

à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¤à¥à¤° à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¸à¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤¯à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥ à¥§ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¤à¥à¤° à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¸à¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤§à¥‹à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥§ à¥¥ " " à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¤à¥à¤° â€œ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‡ à¤–à¤²à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¦à¤®à¥â€ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¥‡ à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤¸à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤¨ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤‚ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤® à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾ à¥¤ à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤ƒ ? à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¸à¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤§à¥‹à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¤à¥ ; " à¤¤à¤œà¥à¤œà¤²à¤¾à¤¨à¥ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¹à¥‡à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤•à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‹à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤ƒ à¥¤ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¸à¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤‚ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤¹à¥‡à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¯à¤¾ à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ à¤¸à¤•à¤²à¥‹- ADHYAYA I, PÄ€DA II SARVATRAPRASIDDHYADHIKARANA 1

  1. Sarvatra prasiddhopadesat Everywhere (He is mentioned); because there is taught (in the scriptures) what is well-known. C The word Brahman that occurs in grammatical equation ith what is mentioned in the text All this is indeed’ (Chand. III. 14-1) refers to the Highest Self. Why? Because in that Upanishat is taught that which is well-known. That all this is the Brahman is proved by the reason stated in the scriptural text, ‘From Him springs the world, in Him it merges and by Him it lives.’ (Chand. III-14-1). What is well-known is said to serve the purpose of a reason. From all 1 à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¤à¥à¤° omitted A 1. à¥§) à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥¬à¥§ à¤ªà¤¨à¤¿à¤·à¤¤à¥à¤¸à¥ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤®à¥ˆà¤µ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤œà¤—à¤œà¥à¤œà¤¨à¤¿à¤²à¤¯à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤¨à¤¹à¥‡à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¯à¤¾ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¸à¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤‚ â€œ à¤¯à¤¤à¥‹ à¤µà¤¾ à¤‡à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¿ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥ || à¤µà¤¿à¤µà¤•à¥à¤·à¤¿à¤¤à¤—à¥à¤£à¥‹à¤ªà¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤¶à¥à¤š à¥¥ à¥¨ à¥¥ à¤®à¤¨à¥‹à¤®à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤µ à¤¸à¤¤à¥à¤¯ à¤¸à¤‚à¤•à¤²à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤¯à¥‹ à¤µà¤¿à¤µà¤•à¥à¤·à¤¿à¤¤à¤¾ à¤—à¥à¤£à¤¾: ‘à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤®à¤£à¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤µà¥‹à¤ªà¤ªà¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¥ à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤ªà¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥ à¤¨ à¤¶à¤¾à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¥© à¥¥ à¤¦à¥à¤ƒà¤–à¤®à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤°à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤®à¤¿à¤¤ à¤¸à¥à¤–à¤²à¤µà¤­à¤¾à¤—à¤¿à¤¨à¤¿ à¤¶à¤¾à¤°à¥€à¤°à¥‡ à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤·à¤¾à¤‚ à¤—à¥à¤£à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤ªà¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤°à¥à¤¨ à¤¶à¤¾à¤°à¥€à¤°à¥‹à¤½à¤¯à¤®à¥ à¥¥ the Upanisadic passages such as ‘From whom all these things. are born’ (Tait. III - 1 ) the Brahman is well-known to be the cause of the creation, sustenance and destruction of the world.
  2. Vivaksitagunopapattesca And because the qualities meant to be stated, are possible (only in the Brahman). The qualities meant to be stated, such as ‘being knowable by mind alone’ ’true will’ etc. are justifiable only in the Brahman.
  3. Anupapattestu na sarirah But on account of impossibility, (He is) not the embodied self. These attributes are not justifiable in the embodied self, who enjoys sufferings mixed with a little pleasure. Hence this cannot be the embodied self. à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤®à¤£ à¤à¤µ M 3. ‘à¤¤à¥ omitted A1. à¥¬à¥¨ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: à¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¤•à¤°à¥à¤¤à¥ƒà¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤šà¥à¤š à¥¥ à¥ª à¥¥ [ à¤…à¤§à¤¿. " à¤à¤¤à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤¸à¤‚à¤­à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤­à¤¿à¤¸à¤‚à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤¸à¤‚à¤­à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤®à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤¯à¥‹à¤°à¥à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¦à¤­à¤¿à¤¸à¤‚à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤‚ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤® à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤®à¥ à¥¥ à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥‡à¤·à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥« à¥¥ " à¤à¤· à¤® à¤†à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥à¤¹à¥ƒà¤¦à¤¯à¥‡ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤·à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¯à¤¾ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¯à¤¾ à¤š à¤œà¥€à¤µà¥‹ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤®à¤š à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ à¤¤à¤¤à¤¶à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤®à¥ à¥¥ à¤¸à¥à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¥‡à¤¶à¥à¤š à¥¥ à¥¬ à¥¥
  4. Karmakartrvyapadesacca And because there is separate denotation of both as the object and the agent. C The scriptural statement, Departing hence, I shall attain Him’ (Chand. III-14-4) denotes the Brahman as the object to be attained and the individual self as the agent who attains. Therefore, the object to be attained is the Brahman, who is other than the individual self.
  5. Sabdavisesat ( It is so ) on account (of the use) of words in different manner. The scriptural text, ‘He is my Self within the heart’ (Chand. III-14-3) designates the embodied self with the word. in the genitive case and also the Brahman with that in the nominative case.
  6. Smrtes’ca And on account of the authority of smrti.à¥§] à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥¬à¥© ‘à¤…à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¥‹à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤® à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¨à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤šà¥€à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ " à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤šà¤¾à¤¹à¤‚ à¤¹à¥ƒà¤¦à¤¿ à¤¸à¤‚à¤¨à¤¿à¤µà¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤¸à¥à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¿à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¥¤ à¤…à¤°à¥à¤­à¤•à¥Œà¤•à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤¬à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤š à¤¨à¥‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¬à¥‡à¤², à¤¨à¤¿à¤šà¤¾à¤¯à¥à¤¯- à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤‚ à¤µà¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤®à¤µà¤šà¥à¤š à¥¥ à¥­ à¥¥ (( à¤à¤· à¤® à¤†à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥à¤¹à¥ƒà¤¦à¤¯à¥‡à¤½à¤£à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨à¥ à¤µà¥à¤°à¥€à¤¹à¥‡à¤ƒ " " " " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¤¾à¤²à¥à¤ªà¤¾à¤¯à¤¤à¤¨à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾- à¤²à¥à¤ªà¤¸à¥à¤µà¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤µà¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤šà¥à¤š à¤¨à¤¾à¤¯à¤‚ à¤ªà¤° à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¤à¥, à¤¨; à¤‰à¤ªà¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤§à¥‡à¤¤à¥‹à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾ It is determined that the Highest Person is exhibited in the nominative case here; because the Smá¹›ti reveals thus– â€¢ And I dwell within the hearts of all’ (Bh. GitÄ XV-15 ) .
  7. Arbhakaukastvat tadvyapades’acca neti cenna, nicayyatvadevaá¹ vyomavacca Should it be said that the passage does not refer to the Brahman on account of the smallness of the abode stated, and on account of denotation of that (i.e. minute- ness of the being); we say no; because the Brahman has to be meditated upon thus, and because in the same passage He is said to be like ether. The scriptural text, ‘He is my Self within the heart and smaller than a grain of rice ’ ( ChÄnd. III-14-3) declares the being as dwelling within the minute abode. He is also de- signated as having a minute size. Hence he is not the Highest one. It is not so. He has been so designated only à¤¨à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤µà¤¯: M 1. à¤…à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ªà¤¿ M 1, 2, 3. à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¤¾à¤²à¥à¤ªà¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾ A 2, M 1, 2. à¥¬à¥ª à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶: ; à¤¨ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¾à¤²à¥à¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨ à¥¤ à¤µà¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤®à¤µà¤¤à¥ à¥¤ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤®à¤¹à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤‚ à¤šà¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥ˆà¤µ à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡, " à¤œà¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨à¥ à¤ªà¥ƒà¤¥à¤¿à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤¾ à¤œà¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤¿à¤•à¥à¤·à¤¾à¤¤à¥ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¤¾ à¥¥ à¤¸à¤‚à¤­à¥‹à¤—à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤°à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¨, à¤µà¥ˆà¤¶à¥‡à¤·à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥® à¥¥ à¤ªà¤°à¥‹à¤½à¤ªà¥à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°à¥‡ à¤µà¤¸à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¤à¥, à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤µà¤¤à¥ à¤¸à¥à¤–à¤¦à¥à¤ƒà¤–à¥‹à¤ªà¤­à¥‹à¤—à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤ƒ à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¤à¥’; à¤¨ à¤¹à¥‡à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥ˆà¤¶à¥‡à¤·à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¤ à¤ªà¤°à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤šà¥à¤›à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¤¤à¥‹’ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤°à¤•à¥à¤·à¤¾à¤¯à¥ˆ à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¸à¤ƒ à¥¥ for the purpose of meditation and not because of His minute size. The illustrative example is the ether. The bigness of His size has been stated in the scriptural text, â€˜Greater than the earth, greater than the sky etc.’ (Chand. III-14-3).
  8. Sambhogapraptiriti cenna, vais’eÅŸyat Should it be said that there is happening of fruition (of pleasure and pain in the Highest Person); we reply, not so, on account of distinction. Suppose the Highest Person lives within the body of the individual selves; then He has to enjoy the fruits of pleasure and pain, as in the case of the individual selves. It is not so, because the difference of the cause of it. The Highest Person lives within the body of the individual selves, only on His own will in order to save them. J ‘à¤šà¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¥ˆà¤¤à¤¤à¥ A 1. * à¤›à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¤¤à¥‹ M à¥©. f omitted M 1, à¥¨] à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥¬à¥« (( à¤…à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥ à¥¨ à¤…à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¾ à¤šà¤°à¤¾à¤šà¤°à¤—à¥à¤°à¤¹à¤£à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥¯ à¥¥ à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤® à¤š à¤•à¥à¤·à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤‚ à¤š à¤‰à¤­à¥‡ à¤­à¤µà¤¤ à¤“à¤¦à¤¨à¤ƒ à¥¤ à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤ªà¤¸à¥‡à¤šà¤¨à¤‚ à¤• à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¥à¤¾ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦ à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤¸à¤ƒ à¥¥ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥Œà¤¦à¤¨à¥‹à¤ªà¤¸à¥‡à¤šà¤¨ ‘à¤¸à¥‚à¤šà¤¿à¤¤à¥‹à¤½à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¾ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¤ƒ, à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤®à¤•à¥à¤·à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥‹à¤ªà¤²à¤•à¥à¤·à¤¿à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤šà¤°à¤¾à¤šà¤°à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤¸à¥à¤¨à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥‚à¤ªà¤¸à¥‡à¤šà¤¨à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨à¤¾à¤¦à¤¨à¥€à¤¯à¤¤à¤¯à¤¾ à¤—à¥à¤°à¤¹à¤£à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤¾à¤š à¥¥ à¥§à¥¦ à¥¥ ATTRADHIKARAÅ…A 2
  9. Atta caracaragrahaÅ†at The eater (is the Highest Self) ; because (He) takes for food, all that is movable and immovable. ‘Who really knows where He is, to whom both BrÄhmaá¹‡as2 and Ká¹£attriyas’ are food and death is a condiment.’ (Kath. 1-2-25). Here the eater suggested by the words, food and condiment, is the Highest Self; because He is said to be the eater of all that is movable and immovable, implied by the words, the BrÄhmaá¹‡as and Ká¹£attriyas using the death as condiment. 1
  10. PrakaranÄcca And (also) on account of the context. ’ à¤‰à¤ªà¤¸à¥‡à¤šà¤¨ omitted A 1. ‘The Brahmanas are of the priestly class and the KÅŸattriyas are of the warrior class. 9 à¥¬à¥¬ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°à¤ƒ [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. " à¤®à¤¹à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤‚ à¤µà¤¿à¤­à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤‚ à¤®à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾ à¤§à¥€à¤°à¥‹ à¤¨ à¤¶à¥‹à¤šà¤¤à¤¿ " " à¤¨à¤¾à¤¯à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤µà¤šà¤¨à¥‡à¤¨ à¤²à¤­à¥à¤¯à¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¤¾ à¤ªà¤°à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¥ˆà¤µ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤¸ à¤à¤µà¤¾à¤¯à¤®à¥ à¥¥ à¤—à¥à¤¹à¤¾à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤µà¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¾à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¥Œ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤¤à¤¦à¤°à¥à¤¶à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥§à¥§ à¥¥ à¤…à¤¨à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤®à¥ " à¤‹à¤¤à¤‚ à¤ªà¤¿à¤µà¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥Œ à¤¸à¥à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¥‡ à¤—à¥à¤¹à¤¾à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤µà¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¥Œ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¥‡ à¤ªà¤°à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡à¤‚ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¤¾ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤µà¥‡à¤µ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¯à¥‹à¤œà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¯à¥‹à¤œà¤•à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¥‡à¤¨ à¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¤«à¤²à¤¾- à¤¶à¤¨à¥‡à¤½à¤¨à¥à¤µà¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤ªà¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¥Œ à¤¤à¤¯à¥‹à¤°à¥‡à¤µà¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤¨à¥ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤•à¤°à¤£à¥‡ à¤—à¥à¤¹à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤µà¥‡à¤¶à¤¦à¤°à¥à¤¶à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ ; " à¤¤à¤‚ à¤¦à¥à¤°à¥à¤¦à¤°à¥à¤¶ à¥® There are scriptural texts-‘The wise, who knows the Self, the Great and Omnipresent, does not grieve ’ ( Kath. I-2-22). This Self is not to be obtained by instruction ’ (Kath. I-2-23). These passages refer to the Highest Person only according to the context and therefore He alone is meant here.
  11. Guham praviá¹£á¹­ÄvÄtmÄnau hi taddarsanat The two entered into the cave’ are the two selves on account of this being seen (in the scriptures). " In the scriptural passage The two, drinking the reward of the good action in the world, have entered the cave in the excellent and highest sphere, ’ (Kath. I-3-1 ) are mentioned the individual self and the Supreme Self only as they are connected as an impeller and impelled, with the enjoyment of the reward of action, as they only are said to have entered the cave in this context. Of these, the Highest Self is referred to in the text Him, who is difficult to see, hidden, entered into the beings and set in the cave’ (Kath. I-2-12). The ndividual self is referred to in the text, ‘Who is together C à¥¨] à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥¬à¥­ à¤—à¥‚à¤¢à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤µà¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤‚ à¤—à¥à¤¹à¤¾à¤¹à¤¿à¤¤à¤®à¥ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¤°à¤¸à¥à¤¯, " à¤¯à¤¾ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¥‡à¤¨ à¤¸à¤‚à¤­à¤µà¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤¤à¤¾- à¤®à¤¯à¥€ à¤—à¥à¤¹à¤¾à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤¯ à¤¤à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥€ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¥¤ à¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¤«à¤²à¤¾à¤¦ ‘à¤¨à¤¾à¤¦à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤ƒ à¥¥ à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥‡à¤·à¤£à¤¾à¤šà¥à¤š à¥¥ à¥§à¥¨ à¥¥ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤ªà¤°à¤¾à¤µà¥‡à¤µ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤¨à¥ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤•à¤°à¤£à¥‡ à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥‡à¤·à¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ " à¤¨ à¤œà¤¾à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¤®à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¤µà¤¾ à¤µà¤¿à¤ªà¤¶à¥à¤šà¤¿à¤¤à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¥Œ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤ƒ ; " à¤…à¤£à¥‹à¤°à¤£à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨à¥ à¤®à¤¹à¤¤à¥‹ à¤®à¤¹à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨à¥ " " ’ à¤®à¤¹à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤‚ à¤µà¤¿à¤­à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¥ " " à¤¨à¤¾à¤¯à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤µà¤šà¤¨à¥‡à¤¨ " with the vital breath, who is aditi, who functions with the senses, and who entering into the cave abides therein.’ (Kath. II-1-7). Here (what is denoted by the word), aditi is the individual self as he eats the fruit of his action.
  12. Visesanacca And on account of distinctive qualities (appre- hended in the individual selves and the Highest Self). Everywhere in the context the distinctive qualities of the individual selves and the Highest Self are stated. The individual self is referred to in the scriptural text-‘The wise one (Vipascit) is not born nor dies’ (Kath. I-2-18). The Highest Self is referred to in the following texts- (1) ‘He is more minute than the minute and more huge than the huge’ (Kath. I-2-20). " (2) â€” The Great and All - pervading Soul’ (Kath. I-2-22). (3) This Self is not to be obtained by teaching (Kath. I-2-23). 1 à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥€à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿: M 2.à¥¬à¥® à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: à¤µà¤¿à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¸à¤¾à¤°à¤¥à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥ à¤®à¤¨à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤—à¥à¤°à¤¹à¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤°à¤ƒ à¥¤ à¤¸à¥‹à¤½à¤§à¥à¤µà¤¨à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤¨à¥‹à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤·à¥à¤£à¥‹à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤‚ à¤ªà¤¦à¤®à¥ à¥¥ " [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥ à¤ªà¤°à¤ƒ à¥¤ " à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¤‚ à¤¦à¤¿à¤µà¤¿ " " à¤…à¤¥ à¤¯à¤¦à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¥‹ à¤¦à¤¿à¤µà¥‹ à¤œà¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤¤à¤¿à¤¦à¤ªà¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤µà¤¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤ à¥‡à¤·à¥ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤ à¥‡à¤·à¥à¤µà¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤®à¥‡à¤·à¥‚à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤®à¥‡à¤·à¥ à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¥‡à¤·à¥ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤µà¤¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤ªà¤°à¤‚ à¤µà¤¿à¤·à¥à¤£à¥‹à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤‚ à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¥‡à¤µ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤¸à¤‚à¤¸à¤¾à¤°à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤µà¤¨à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤°à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤‚ à¤®à¥à¤®à¥à¤•à¥à¤·à¥à¤­à¤¿à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤¯à¤‚ â€œ à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤·à¥à¤£à¥‹à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤‚ à¤ªà¤¦à¤‚ à¤¸à¤¦à¤¾ à¤ªà¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¸à¥‚à¤°à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤¤à¤¦à¤•à¥à¤·à¤°à¥‡ (4) ’ But who has understanding for his charioteer, and holds the reins of the mind, he reaches the destination of his journey that highest place of Visnu’ ( Katha. 1-3-9). The scriptural texts,’ His three immortal feet are in the Highest Heaven’ (Chand. III-12-6) and ‘Now that Light, which shines beyond this Highest Heaven, beyond all the things in the universe, beyond the whole universe, in the highest world than which there are no higher worlds,’ (ChÃ¤nd. III-13-7) state that the aspirant of Mukti (i.e. final release) desires to reach the place of Visnu, which is higher than this world of Praká¹›ti and which is beyond the reach of the path. leading to Samsara. This has been established in all the Upanishads thus- (1) The wise sages always see the Highest Heaven of VisÅ†u’ (Tait. Sam. I-3-6 ) . ( 2 ) ’ He is in the imperishable Highest Heaven ’ (Tait. II. 1-1 ) . à¤ªà¤°à¤‚ M 2. Samsara means the circuit of mundane existence consisting of frequent births and deaths and all their consequences. à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥©] à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¥‡ à¤µà¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤®à¤¨à¥ " (C à¤•à¥à¤·à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤®à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤°à¤œà¤¸à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤¾à¤•à¥‡ " à¥¬à¥¯ " à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤µà¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤‚ à¤¤à¤®à¤¸à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤¤à¥ " " à¤¤à¥‡ à¤¹ à¤¨à¤¾à¤•à¤‚ à¤®à¤¹à¤¿à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤šà¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤ªà¥‚à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‡ à¤¸à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤¾à¤ƒ" à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¸à¤•à¤²à¥‹à¤ªà¤¨à¤¿à¤·à¤¤à¥à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¸à¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤®à¥ à¥¥ à¥¤ à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥ à¥© à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤° à¤‰à¤ªà¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¥§à¥© à¥¥ " à¤¯ à¤à¤·à¥‹à¤½à¤•à¥à¤·à¤¿à¤£à¤¿ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¥‹ à¤¦à¥ƒà¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤ à¤à¤· à¤†à¤¤à¥à¤®à¥‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¹à¥‹à¤µà¤¾à¤š à¥¤ à¤à¤¤à¤¦à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¤®- à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤•à¥à¤·à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¤¾à¤°à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¤ƒ, à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤¾à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤­à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤µ à¤¸à¤‚à¤¯à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¾- à¤®à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¥€à¤¨à¤¾à¤‚ à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¥‡à¤µà¥‹à¤ªà¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¤­à¤¯à¤®à¥‡à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤® (3) Him who is dwelling in the place which is beyond the Rajas’ (Tait. Sam. II-2-12-5 ) . (4) ‘The All-pervading one, ancient, and beyond the reach of darkness’ (Tait. II-1-1). (5) Those, who are great, indeed reach the Heaven where there are ancient gods known as Sadhyas’ (Tait. Ä€r. III-12-39). ANTARÄ€DHIKARAÅ…A 3
  13. Antara upapattel (The person) within (the eye) is the Highest Self ; because (it is so) apprehended in ( scriptural texts). ’ The person, who is seen in the eye, is the Self, said he. This is the Immortal and Fearless, This is the Brahman’ (Chand. IV-15-1). Here the Person, who is said to be in the eye, is the Highest Person. The qualities such as death- lessness, fearlessness and SamyadvÄmatva etc., that have no limiting conditions, can be possible only in the Highest Self. 1 à¤à¤·à¥‹à¤½à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤•à¥à¤·à¤¿à¤£à¤¿ M 1. à¤…à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤¤ A 1, 2. à¤à¤¤à¤¦à¤­à¤¯à¤®à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤ M 3. ‘He is called Saá¹yadvÄma as all blessings go towards Him. 8 à¥­à¥¦ à¤ªà¤°à¤ƒ || à¤ªà¤°à¤ƒ || " à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤šà¥à¤š à¥¥ à¥§à¥ª à¥¥ [ à¤…à¤§à¤¿. à¤¯à¤¶à¥à¤šà¤•à¥à¤·à¥à¤·à¤¿ à¤¤à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¨à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¤¾ à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿à¤¨à¤¿à¤¯à¤®à¤¨à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤šà¥à¤šà¤¾à¤¯à¤‚ à¤¸à¥à¤–à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¦à¥‡à¤µ à¤š à¥¥ à¥§à¥« à¥¥ " à¤•à¤‚ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤® à¤–à¤‚ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤® " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¥‚à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¥ˆà¤µ à¤¸à¥à¤–à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¤à¤¯à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤šà¥à¤šà¤¾à¤¯à¤‚ à¤…à¤¤ à¤à¤µ à¤š à¤¸ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤® à¥¥ à¥§à¥¬ à¥¥ à¤¯à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤­à¤µà¤­à¥€à¤¤à¤¾à¤¯à¥‹à¤ªà¤•à¥‹à¤¸à¤²à¤¾à¤¯ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤® à¤œà¤¿à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¸à¤µà¥‡ “à¤•à¤‚ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤® à¤–à¤‚ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤®
  14. Sthanadivyapadesacca And on account of the statement as to the abode, etc. That He dwells within the eye and at the same time He rules over the eye is proved in the text, ‘He who dwells within the eye etc.’ (Brh. III-7-18). Therefore this must be the Highest Self.
  15. Sukhavisist abhidhanadevaca And on account of the very same text referring to what is characterised by Pleasure. The scriptural text, ‘Pleasure is the Brahman. Ether is the Brahman’ (Chand. IV-10-5) refers only to what is characterised by Pleasure. Hence this must be the Highest Self.
  16. Ata eva ca sa Brahma For that very reason that ( ether) is the Brahman. Here Upakosala being afraid of Samsara, made the inquiry about the Brahman. Then he was taught that the Pleasure was the Brahman and the Ether was the Brahman. 1 à¤­à¤µà¤­à¤¯ M 1, 2. à¥©] à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥­à¥§ à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥à¤ªà¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤ƒ " à¤¯à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤µ à¤•à¤‚ à¤¤à¤¦à¥‡à¤µ à¤–à¤®à¥” à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¸à¥à¤–à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤ƒ, à¤…à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤–à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤§à¥‡à¤¯ à¤†à¤•à¤¾à¤¶à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¥‡à¤µ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤® || à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¥‹à¤ªà¤¨à¤¿à¤·à¤¤à¥à¤•à¤—à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤­à¤¿à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤šà¥à¤š à¥¥ à¥§à¥­ à¥¥ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤®à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¾à¤£à¤¾à¤®à¤§à¤¿à¤—à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¤¾ à¤…à¤°à¥à¤šà¤¿à¤°à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤—à¤¤à¥‡à¤° à¤•à¥à¤·à¤¿à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¤‚ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤µà¤¤à¥‡ " à¤¤à¥‡à¤½à¤°à¥à¤šà¤¿à¤·à¤®à¥‡à¤µà¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤¸à¤‚à¤­à¤µà¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤šà¥à¤šà¤¾à¤¯à¤‚ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¤ƒ || à¤…à¤¨à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¿à¤¤à¥‡à¤°à¤¸à¤‚à¤­à¤µà¤¾à¤šà¥à¤š à¤¨à¥‡à¤¤à¤°à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¥§à¥® à¥¥ Again it has been stated ‘That which is denoted by the word ’ Pleasure’ is identical with that denoted by the word ’ Ether ’ (ChÃ¤nd. IV-10-5). Therefore the Ether identified with the Pleasure, is the Highest Brahman.
  17. Srutopanisatkagatyabhidhanacca And on account of the statement of the way of him who has heard of the Upanisads. For him who has heard of the Person within the eye, the scriptural passage ‘They go to light etc.’ (Chand. IV-15-5) prescribes the same way marked with light etc. as prescribed for them who have heard of the true nature of the Brahman. Hence this is the Highest Person.
  18. Anavasthiterasambhavacca netarah ( It ) cannot (be ) any other ( than the Highest Self) on account of its non-residence (in eye) and of the impossibility (of possessing the characteristics des- cribed). à¥­à¥¨ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. à¤ªà¤°à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¤°à¥‹ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¨à¤¾à¤•à¥à¤·à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¤¾à¤°à¤ƒ ; à¤šà¤•à¥à¤·à¥à¤·à¤¿ à¤¨à¤¿à¤¯à¤®à¥‡à¤¨à¤¾à¤¨à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¿à¤¤à¥‡:, à¤…à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤¯ à¤¸à¤‚à¤­à¤µà¤¾à¤š || à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¥à¤¯à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥ à¥ª à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¥à¤¯à¤§à¤¿à¤¦à¥ˆà¤µà¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥ à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤°à¥à¤®à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥§à¥¯ à¥¥ " à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥ƒà¤¥à¤¿à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤‚ à¤¤à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¨à¥ â€ à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤µà¤§à¤¿à¤¦à¥ˆà¤µà¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¤¾ à¤¦à¤¿à¤ªà¤¦ à¤šà¤¿à¤¹à¥à¤¨à¤¿à¤¤à¥‡à¤·à¥ à¤µà¤¾à¤•à¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤·à¥ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¤¯à¤®à¤¾à¤£à¥‹à¤½à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¥€ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¤ƒ, à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤µà¤¿à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°- à¤•à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µ à¤¨à¤¿à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤§à¤°à¥à¤®à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ The individual selves, etc. who are other than the Highest Self, cannot have their residence in the eye. They do not always reside in the eye and they do not (possess the characteristics) of immortality etc. ANTARYAMYADIKARANA 4
  19. Antaryamyadhidaivadhilokadisu taddharma- vyapadesat The Internal Ruler (referred to) in the texts with respect to the Gods, with respect to the worlds, etc. (is the Highest Person); because the attributes of Him are mentioned. The Internal Ruler, mentioned in the various passages in respect of the Gods, in respect of the worlds etc., is the Highest Person; because the qualities of the Highest Person, such as, being the Internal Ruler, being unknown by all, having all as His body, being the All-controller and so on, are mentioned there.à¥ª] à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¤¨ à¤š à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤®à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤°à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤²à¤¾à¤ªà¤¾à¤šà¥à¤›à¤¾à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤¶à¥à¤š à¥¥ à¥¨à¥¦ à¥¥ à¥­à¥© à¤¨à¤¾à¤¯à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤‚ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤¶à¥à¤µ, à¤¤à¤¯à¥‹à¤°à¤¸à¤‚à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤µà¤¿à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤§à¤°à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤²à¤¾à¤ªà¤¾à¤¤à¥’ à¥¤ à¤…à¤¸à¤‚à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¤¨à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¯à¤¥à¤¾ à¤¨ à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤®à¥, à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¥‹à¤½à¤ªà¥€à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¤‰à¤­à¤¯à¥‡à¤½à¤ªà¤¿ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤­à¥‡à¤¦à¥‡à¤¨à¥ˆà¤¨à¤®à¤§à¥€à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¥ à¥¨à¥§ à¥¥ à¤‰à¤­à¤¯à¥‡ à¤•à¤¾à¤£à¥à¤µà¤¾ à¤®à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤‚à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¤¾à¤¶à¥à¤š, â€œà¤¯à¥‹ à¤µà¤¿à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¥‡ à¤¤à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¨à¥ " " à¤¯ à¤†à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¨à¤¿ à¤¤à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¨à¥‹à¤½à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥‹ à¤¯à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾ à¤¨ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦ à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾ à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤‚ à¤¯ à¤†à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥‹
  20. Na ca smartamataddharmabhilapaccharirasca This is not the Smarta i.e. Pradhana; on account of the declaration of the qualities not belonging to it; nor the embodied self. Neither the Pradhana nor the individual self is He; because the qualities such as becoming unknown to all which are not impossible in them, have been mentioned therein. Just as He cannot be the Pradhana, because these qualities are im- possible in it, for the same reason, He cannot be the individual self also.
  21. Ubhayepi hi bhedenainam adhÄ«yate For, both (also) speak of Him as something different. Both, the Madhyamdinas and the Kanvas, speak of the Inner Ruler as being different from the individual self. The scriptural text meant here is this-’ He who dwelling within the knowledge’ ‘He, who dwelling in the individual self, is within the individual self, whom 1 à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¥¦ A 2. 10 à¥­à¥ª à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°à¤ƒ [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. à¤¯à¤®à¤¯à¤¤à¤¿" à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤—à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¨à¥‹ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤—à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¨à¥‹ à¤­à¥‡à¤¦à¥‡à¤¨à¥ˆà¤¨à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¤¿à¤£à¤®à¤§à¥€à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ à¤…à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤° à¤à¤µà¤¾à¤¯à¤®à¥ à¥¥ à¤…à¤¦à¥ƒà¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤—à¥à¤£à¤•à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥ à¥« à¤…à¤¦à¥ƒà¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤—à¥à¤£à¤•à¥‹ à¤§à¤°à¥à¤®à¥‹à¤•à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¥¨à¥¨ à¥¥ " à¤…à¤¥ à¤ªà¤°à¤¾ à¤¯à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¤à¤¦à¤•à¥à¤·à¤°à¤®à¤§à¤¿à¤—à¤®à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ " à¤°à¤­à¥à¤¯ (( (( à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¦à¤¦à¥à¤°à¥‡à¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤®à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾- à¤¯à¤¦à¥à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤¯à¥‹à¤¨à¤¿à¤‚ à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤ªà¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ à¤§à¥€à¤°à¤¾à¤ƒ " à¤…à¤•à¥à¤·à¤°à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤ªà¤°à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¥Œ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤—à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¨à¤¶à¥à¤šà¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¤¿à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡, à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤œà¥à¤à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤§à¤°à¥à¤®à¥‹à¤•à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¤ªà¤°à¤ƒ " " à¤¯à¤ƒ the individual self does not know, whose body is the individual self, who internally rules the individual self.’ (MÄdh. Bh. III - 7). Therefore this is only the Highest One. ADá¹šS’YATVÄ€DIGUá¹†AKÄ€DHIKARAÅ…A 5
  22. AdrsyatvadigunÅ†ako dharmoktel He who possesses the qualities of invisibility etc.. (is the Highest Self); on account of the declaration of the attributes.
