  2. Tatpurvakatvad vacal! On account of the speech having for its antecedent the creation. The objects, other than the Highest Self, could be designated by names, only after the creation of the fire etc, by the Highest Self. Therefore at that time, the word, Prana cannot refer to the sense-organs. SAPTAGATYADHIKARANA 2
  3. Sapta gatervisesitatvacca They are seven on account of the mentioning of movement and of specification. The sense-organs are only seven in number. ‘The seven PrÄnÄs come forth from Him ’ ( Mund. II-1-8 ). ’ When the five senses of knowledge stand still together with the mind and when the Buddhi does not move’ (Kath. II-3-10 ). From the above mentioned scriptural texts it is understood that only the seven senses move with the individual selves and 29 à¥¨à¥¨à¥¬ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: à¤¹à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤¦à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥ à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¿à¤¤à¥‡à¤½à¤¤à¥‹ à¤¨à¥ˆà¤µà¤®à¥ à¥¥ à¥« à¥¥ [à¤…à¤µà¤¿. "” à¤¹à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤¦à¤¯à¥‹à¤½à¤ªà¥€à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾à¤£à¤¿, à¤œà¥€à¤µà¥‡ à¤¦à¥‡à¤¹à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¿à¤¤à¥‡ à¤‰à¤ªà¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤•à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥‡à¤·à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¤ à¤…à¤¤à¥‹ à¤¨ à¤¸à¤ªà¥à¤¤à¥ˆà¤µ à¥¤ à¤…à¤ªà¤¿ à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤•à¤¾à¤¦à¤¶; â€œ à¤¦à¤¶à¥‡à¤®à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤¾ à¤†à¤¤à¥à¤®à¥ˆà¤•à¤¾à¤¦à¤¶à¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾à¤£à¤¿ à¤¦à¤¶à¥ˆà¤•à¤‚ à¤š" à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤¸à¥à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¿à¤­à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¥ | à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¥à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¯à¥‹ à¤®à¤¨à¥‹à¤µà¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¿ - à¤­à¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤ƒ à¥¤ à¤¸à¤ªà¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤‚ à¤—à¤¤à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤°à¤µà¤£à¤‚ à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥‡à¤·à¤£à¤‚ à¤š à¤¤à¥‡à¤·à¤¾à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤¾à¤£à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥ à¥© à¤…à¤£à¤µà¤¶à¥à¤š à¥¤à¥¤ à¥¬ there are specifications to show that these seven alone are mentioned in connection with the meditation.
  4. Hastadayastu sthiteto naivam But the hands, etc. are also the organs; since they also assist the self when he abides in the body. There- fore it is not so. Hands, etc. are also organs; because they also assist the self, when he abides in the body. Therefore the organs are not seven only; but they are eleven. The scriptural statement is this- Ten are these organs in person and Atman is the eleventh ( Brh. III-9-4 ) . ’ The organs are ten and one’ (Bhag. Gi. XIII-5). Buddhi, etc. are different functions of the Manas (mind). The scriptures mention the movement of the seven sense-organs and specify them. This is due to the fact, that they are prominent among the group. ’ PRAÅ…Ä€á¹†UTVADHIKARAá¹†A 3 6. Anavasca And they are atomic in size. à¥©, à¥ª] à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤šà¤¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥¨à¥¨à¥­ à¤¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¿ à¤šà¤¾à¤£à¥‚à¤¨à¤¿, â€œ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥à¤•à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤‚ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤¾ à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥à¤•à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤—à¤¤à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤°à¤µà¤£à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥‡à¤·à¥à¤ à¤š à¥¥ à¥­ à¥¥ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥‡à¤·à¥à¤ à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤à¥à¤šà¤µà¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¥‹à¤½à¤ªà¥à¤¯à¥à¤¤à¥à¤ªà¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ à¤‰à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤° à¤šà¤¿à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¥à¥‹à¤½à¤¯à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¤µà¤¾à¤¯à¥ à¤•à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥ à¥ª à¤¨ à¤µà¤¾à¤¯à¥à¤•à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥ƒà¤¥à¤—à¥à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥® à¥¥ à¤ªà¤à¥à¤šà¤µà¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¥‹ à¤¨ à¤µà¤¾à¤¯à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤‚, à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤•à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾ à¤µà¤¾ " à¤à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤œà¥à¤œà¤¾à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤ƒ à¤–à¤‚ à¤µà¤¾à¤¯à¥à¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¥ƒà¤¥à¤—à¥à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ These organs are atomic in size. Their movement has been stated in the scriptural text, ‘All these PrÄÅ†Äs (senses) go out following the PrÄna (vital breath ) when it goes out ’ (BÅ†h. IV-4-2). And the best.
  5. Sresthasca By the best’ we have to understand the Prana (vital wind) with its fivefold function. This also is created. This is mentioned separately again here, so that this may be dealt with in the next Sutra also. VAYUKRIYADHIKARAá¹†A 4
  6. Na vayukriye prthagupades at PrÄÅ†a is neither the mere wind nor its function ; on account of its being stated separately. The Prana, that has five functions, is neither mere wind nor its mere functions; because it is taught separately in the scriptural text ‘From Him are produced PrÄna, ether and wind’ (Mund. II-1-3).à¥¨à¥¨à¥® à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: à¤šà¤•à¥à¤·à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤µà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥ à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤¸à¤¹à¤¶à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤˜à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤­à¥à¤¯à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¥¯ à¥¥ [ à¤…à¤§à¤¿. à¤µà¤¾à¤¯à¥‹à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥ƒà¤¥à¤—à¥à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¥‹à¤½à¤¯à¤‚ à¤¨à¤¾à¤®à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤µà¤¦à¥à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤µà¤¾à¤¯à¥à¤°à¥‡à¤µ ‘à¤¦à¥‡à¤¹à¤§à¤¾à¤°à¤£- à¤¯à¥‹à¤—à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤ªà¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¶à¥à¤šà¤•à¥à¤·à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤µà¤œà¥à¤œà¥€à¤µà¥‹à¤ªà¤•à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥, à¤šà¤•à¥à¤·à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤­à¤¿à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤¹à¥‹à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥à¤²à¥à¤¯à¥‹ - à¤ªà¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤¤à¤¨à¥à¤®à¥à¤–à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤­à¥à¤¯à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¤…à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤š à¤¨ à¤¦à¥‹à¤·à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾à¤¹à¤¿ à¤¦à¤°à¥à¤¶à¤¯à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¥ à¥§à¥¦ à¥¥ à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤‚ à¤•à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾ à¥¤ à¤¨ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¥‹à¤ªà¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤•à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾à¤°à¤¹à¤¿à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨’ à¤¦à¥‹à¤·à¤ƒ ; à¤¯à¤¤à¤ƒ
  7. Caká¹£uradivattu tatsahasiá¹£á¹­yadibhyaá¸¥Ä± But it is like the eye, etc., on account of being mentioned along with them and for other reasons. The Prana is distinct from the mere wind; but it is not an element completely different from it, like fire, etc. The wind itself has taken the form, that is useful in sustaining the body and is helpful for the functions of the individual selves, like the eye, etc.; because it is mentioned in the scriptural text along with the eye, etc. It is also equally help- ing the individual selves, like the eye etc. and is important among them.
  8. Akaraá¹‡atvacca nadoá¹£astathahi dars’ayati And no objection arises on account of the absense of its function; for the scriptures declare its function. The word, ‘Karana’ here means function; but no defect arises on the presumption that it has no any action, which may be helpful to the individual selves. Verily the scriptural texts declare that it functions so that the body ‘à¤¦à¥‡à¤¹à¤§à¤¾à¤°à¤£à¤¯à¥‹à¤—à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤¤à¤¾à¤®à¥ A 1, M 1. à¤¬à¥‡ Pr. 4] à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤šà¤¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥¨à¥¨à¥¯ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤°à¥‡à¤µ à¤¦à¥‡à¤¹à¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¶à¥ˆà¤¥à¤¿à¤²à¥à¤¯ à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤‚ à¤¦à¤°à¥à¤¶à¤¯à¤¤à¤¿, à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¥‹à¤¤à¥à¤•à¥à¤°à¤®à¤£à¥‡ à¤¦à¥‡à¤¹à¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿- à¤¶à¥ˆà¤¥à¤¿à¤²à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¤ªà¤¶à¥à¤à¥à¤šà¤µà¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤®à¤¨à¥‹à¤µà¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¥ à¥§à¥§ à¥¥ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£ à¤à¤• à¤à¤µ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤µà¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤­à¤¿à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤à¥à¤šà¤­à¤¿à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤¾à¤ªà¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¤¾à¤®à¤­à¤¾à¤—à¥à¤­à¤µà¤¤à¤¿ ; à¤•à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤­à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¥à¥ˆà¤•à¤®à¥‡à¤µ à¤®à¤¨à¤ƒ à¤•à¤¾à¤®à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤‚à¤•à¤²à¥à¤ªà¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤°à¤­à¥à¤¯ " à¤à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‡ à¤®à¤¨ à¤à¤µ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¥ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥‡à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥ à¥« à¤…à¤£à¥à¤¶à¥à¤š à¥¤à¥¤ à¥§à¥¨ à¥¤à¥¤ â€œ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¥‹à¤½à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥à¤•à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤®à¤¤à¤¿" à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥à¤¤à¥à¤•à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤°à¤£à¥à¤ƒ || and the sense-organs may not be nullified; because, it is said that when the Prana leaves the body, the body and the sense- organs become nullified or invalidated.
  9. PaÃ±cavrttirmanovadvyapadis’yate It is designated as possessing five-fold function like the Manas ( mind). The Prana alone due to its five functions has different titles as PrÄÅ†a, ApÄna, etc. This is similar to the division of Manas ( mind), that is only one, into a number of varieties, such as desire, etc. This is stated in the scriptural text beginning with ‘Desire, will, and ending with ‘All this is truly mind’ (Byh.   10. Jyotiradyadhiá¹£á¹­hanaá¹ tu tadamananat pranavata, s’abdat But the ruling over the senses on the part of the fire etc, along with the self, is owing to the will of that Highest Self; on account of the scriptural statement. The fire, etc. along with the individual self, have their control over the sense-organs, due to the will of the Highest Self. This is stated in the scriptural text, Dwelling in the fire, He controls the fire from within ’ (Brh. III- 7-5).
  11. Tasya ca nityatvat And because of this being invariable. It is because of the fact that everything is invariably under His control. ‘à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤š A 1. à¤µà¤šà¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ M 1. à¥¬, à¥­] à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤šà¤¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤¥: à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦: à¥¨à¥©à¥§ à¤‡à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥ à¥­ à¤¤ à¤‡à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾à¤£à¤¿ à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¦à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥‡à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥§à¥« à¥¥ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥‡à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¾à¤¦à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¤ à¤‡à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾à¤£à¤¿, à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¤ à¤‡à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾à¤£à¤¿ à¤¤à¥‡à¤·à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤µà¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¤à¥ " à¤‡à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾à¤£à¤¿ à¤¦à¤¶à¥ˆà¤•à¤‚ à¤š " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¥Œ à¥¥ à¤®à¥‡à¤¦à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤°à¥à¤µà¥ˆà¤²à¤•à¥à¤·à¤£à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤š à¥¥ à¥§à¥¬ à¥¥ " à¤à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤œà¥à¤œà¤¾à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¥‹ à¤®à¤¨à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾à¤£à¤¿ à¤š " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤­à¥‡à¤¦à¥‡ - à¤¨à¥‹à¤¤à¥à¤ªà¤¤à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤ƒ à¤‡à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤µà¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¥‡à¤½à¤ªà¤¿ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤µà¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤µà¥ˆà¤²à¤•à¥à¤·à¤£à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤š || ; INDRIYADHIKARANA 7
  12. Ta indriyani tadvyapadesadanyatra sresthat With the exception of the best, they are the sense- organs; because they are so designated. The PrÄnÄs, other than the best (MukhyaprÄna) are the sense-organs; because they are so designated. The authority here is this The sense-organs are ten and one’ (Bhag. G. XIII-5).
  13. Bhedasrutervailaksanyacca On account of the scriptural statement of dif- ference and on account of distinction in characteristics. as The scriptural text, that states that the Prana is created different from the sense-organs is this- From Him is originated PrÄna, mind and all the sense organs’ (Mund. II-1-3). It is also thus because the functions of the Prana do not stop, even when the sense-organs cease to function. Hence the sense-organs and the Prana possess distinct characteristics. à¥¨à¥©à¥¨ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: à¤¸à¤‚à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤®à¥‚à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤•à¥à¤²à¤ªà¥à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥ à¥® [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. à¤¸à¤‚à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤®à¥‚à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤•à¥à¤²à¤ªà¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥ à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤µà¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤•à¥à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¤ à¤‰à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥§à¥­ à¥¥ à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¤¾à¤®à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤µà¥à¤¯à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¿à¤¸à¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤šà¤¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤®à¥à¤–à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤•à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¨ à¤à¤µ, à¤¨ à¤•à¥‡à¤µà¤²- à¤šà¤¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤®à¥à¤–à¤¾à¤¤à¥; â€œ à¤¨à¤¾à¤®à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¥‡ à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤•à¤°à¤µà¤¾à¤£à¤¿ à¥¤ à¤¤à¤¾à¤¸à¤¾à¤‚ à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤µà¥ƒà¤¤à¤‚ à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤µà¥ƒà¤¤à¤®à¥‡à¤•à¥ˆà¤•à¤¾à¤‚ à¤•à¤°à¤µà¤¾à¤£à¤¿ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤µà¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤‚ à¤•à¥à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¤à¥‹ à¤¨à¤¾à¤®à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤µà¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤•à¤°à¤£à¥‹à¤ªà¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¤ à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤µà¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤‚ à¤¤à¥ à¤•à¥‡à¤µà¤²- à¤šà¤¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤®à¥à¤–à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¨ à¤¸à¤‚à¤­à¤µà¤¤à¤¿, à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤µà¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¥ˆà¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤œà¥‹à¤½à¤¬à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¥ˆà¤°à¤£à¥à¤¡à¤®à¥à¤¤à¥à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤¯ à¤ªà¤¶à¥à¤šà¤¾à¤šà¥à¤šà¤¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤®à¥à¤– à¤¸à¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¥‡à¤ƒ ; à¤¤à¤¦à¤£à¥à¤¡à¤®à¤­à¤µà¤¦à¥à¤§à¥ˆà¤®à¤‚ à¤¸à¤¹à¤¸à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤‚à¤¶à¥à¤¸à¤®à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤­à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤¨à¥ à¤œà¤œà¥à¤à¥‡ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¯à¤‚ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤®à¤¾ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤²à¥‹à¤•à¤ªà¤¿à¤¤à¤¾à¤®à¤¹à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¸à¥à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¥‡à¤ƒ à¥¥ SAMJNÄ€MURTIKLPTYADHIKARANA 8
  14. SamjÃ±amurtiklptistu trivá¹›tkurvata upadesat But the assignment of the names and forms be- longs to Him, who does Trivrtkaraá¹‡a (combining the three elements); on account of the scriptural teaching. The assignment of the names and forms such as gods etc. belongs to the Highest Self alone, who has for His body the four-faced god (the creator ) ; and not to the four-faced god himself. This is so because the scriptural text teaches that the assignment of the names and forms was made by the same who did the Trivá¹›tkarana (combining the three elements). The scriptural text is this- Let me differentiate names and forms and let me make each of them as combination of the three elements ’ ( ChÄnd. VI-3-2 ). But the four-faced god cannot do himself the Trivá¹›tkarana. First is created the egg- shaped universe out of fire, water, and food combined together. Subsequently the four-faced god is created. The Smrti text is this ‘That egg-shaped universe of golden colourà¥®] à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤šà¤¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¤®à¤¾à¤‚à¤¸à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿ à¤­à¥Œà¤®à¤‚ à¤¯à¤¥à¤¾à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤°à¤¯à¥‹ à¥¥ à¥§à¥® à¥¥ à¥¨à¥©à¥© " à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤®à¤¶à¤¿à¤¤à¤‚ à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥‡à¤§à¤¾ à¤µà¤¿à¤§à¥€à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤—à¥à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤µà¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤¾à¤¦à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°- à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¥‹à¤½à¤£à¥à¤¡à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥à¤µà¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¤­à¥à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¾à¤¦à¥€à¤¨à¤¾à¤‚ à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤£à¤¾à¤®à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤•à¤¾à¤° à¤‰à¤šà¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤¥à¤¾ à¤®à¤¾à¤‚à¤¸- à¤®à¤¨à¤¸à¥‹à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥€à¤·à¤¾à¤¦à¤£à¥€à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤µ à¤¤à¥ˆà¤œà¤¸à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¸à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤ƒ à¥¤ à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾ à¤¸à¤¤à¤¿ " à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¨- à¤®à¤¶à¤¿à¤¤à¤‚ à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥‡à¤§à¤¾" à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤­à¥‚à¤®à¥‡à¤°à¥‡à¤µ à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥‡à¤§à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‹à¤ªà¤•à¥à¤°à¤®à¤ƒ, " à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤®à¤¯à¤‚ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤¸à¥‹à¤®à¥à¤¯ à¤®à¤¨à¤ƒ " 2 shining like the sun, was created. In that egg was born himself the four-faced Brahman the grandfather of the entire universe’ (Manu. I-9).
  15. Mamsadi bhaumam yathasabdamitarayos’ca Flesh etc. are of earthy nature; in the case of the other two, it has to be considered according to the text. Consider the scriptural text, ‘The food eaten is divided into three parts’ (Chand. VI-5-1). Here is stated the mode of modification of the food etc. taken by men living in the egg-shaped universe, the modification being different from the Trivá¹›tkarana. Otherwise the flesh and the mind (Manas) which are smaller in size than the excavated matters, must have the character of fire and water. the statements, Food taken is formed into three ’ (ChÄnd. VI-5-1); because the earth alone is said to become into the three (i.e. the food, water, and fire). It also contradicts the statement, ’ Oh beloved, ! The mind is Annamaya (the modification, à¥® à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤•à¤¾à¤°: omitted M 3. If it were so, it contradicts à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¸à¤™à¥à¤—à¤¾à¤¤à¥ M 3. 30 à¥¨à¥©à¥ª à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. à¥¤ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤®à¤¨à¤¸à¥‹ à¤­à¥Œà¤®à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤‚ à¤š à¤µà¤¿à¤°à¥à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ à¤¤à¤¥à¥‡à¤¤à¤°à¤¯à¥‹à¤° à¤¤à¥‡à¤œà¤¸à¥‹ à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥ˆà¤µà¤¿à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤‚ à¤µà¤¿à¤°à¥à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¤¤à¤¦à¤¿à¤¦à¤®à¤¾à¤¹ - à¤®à¤¾à¤‚à¤¸à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿ à¤­à¥Œà¤®à¤‚ à¤¯à¤¥à¤¾à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤°à¤¯à¥‹à¤¶à¥à¤šà¥‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¤ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥€à¤·à¤µà¤¨à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤‚à¤¸à¤®à¤¨à¤¸à¥€ à¤…à¤ªà¤¿ à¤­à¥Œà¤®à¥‡ à¤‡à¤¤à¥€à¤¹à¥‹à¤šà¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾ à¤®à¥‚à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤µà¤²à¥à¤²à¥‹à¤¹à¤¿à¤¤à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤¾à¤µà¤µà¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤¯à¥Œ à¥¤ à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾ à¤…à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¿- à¤µà¤¨à¥à¤®à¤œà¥à¤œà¤¾à¤µà¤¾à¤šà¥Œ à¤¤à¥ˆà¤œà¤¸à¥à¤¯à¥Œ || à¤ªà¥‚à¤°à¥à¤µà¤®à¥‡à¤µ à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤µà¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¤‚ à¤šà¥‡à¤¤à¥, à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤•à¤‚ à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥ à¤•à¤¥à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤®à¤¾à¤ªà¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤œ à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥à¤šà¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ ? à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¹ —– à¤µà¥ˆà¤¶à¥‡à¤·à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥ à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¥§à¥¯ à¥¥ of food) ’ (ChÄnd. VI- 5-4); because the mind has the character of earth. In the same way there will be the contradiction in respect of the three-fold modification of the other two, namely, fire and water. Therefore it is stated thus-The flesh, etc. are of earthy nature. In the case of the other two, it has to be considered according to the text.’ Indeed it is stated here. that the flesh and mind, have an earthy nature, like the excavated matters. In the same way the blood, and the PrÄá¹‡a are of watery nature, as in the case of the urine. In the same way the marrow and speech are of fiery nature, as in the case of the bones. There is the combination of the three made already. How then can it be said that the object, that is the combina- tion of the three is mentioned as earth, water and fire? Here the reply is this:-
  16. Vaisesyat tu tadvÄdastadvÄdah But on account of their greater parts, there is that designation, that designation. à¥®] à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤šà¤¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤¥: à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦: à¥¨à¥©à¥« à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤­à¥‚à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨ à¤µà¥ˆà¤¶à¥‡à¤·à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ || à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥€à¤­à¤—à¤µà¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤œà¤µà¤¿à¤°à¤šà¤¿à¤¤à¥‡ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°à¥‡ à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾- à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤šà¤¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤®à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤¤à¤¬à¥à¤§à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¤ƒ They are called food etc. because there are greater parts of food etc. in them. THUS ENDS THE 4TH PADA OF THE 2ND ADHYAYA

à¥§

à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¤¤à¤¦à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¤¿à¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥ à¥§ à¤¤à¤¦à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¤¿à¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥Œ à¤°à¤‚à¤¹à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¸à¤‚à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤µà¤•à¥à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¶à¥à¤¨- à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤£à¤¾à¤­à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¥ à¥¥ à¥§ à¥¥ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¥‹ ‘à¤¦à¥‡à¤¹à¤¾ à¤¦à¥‡à¤¹à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤¤à¥Œ’ à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤¸à¥‚à¤•à¥à¤·à¥à¤®à¥ˆà¤ƒ à¤¸à¤‚à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤µà¤•à¥à¤¤à¥‹ à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥€à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¤à¥à¤šà¤¾à¤­à¤¿- à¤µà¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¤¾à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¶à¥à¤¨à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¤¿à¤µà¤šà¤¨à¤¾à¤­à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¤µà¤—à¤®à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ " à¤µà¥‡à¤¤à¥à¤¥ à¤¯à¤¥à¤¾ à¤ªà¤à¥à¤šà¤­à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤¹à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤µà¤¾à¤ªà¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¤µà¤šà¤¸à¥‹ à¤­à¤µà¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¶à¥à¤¨à¤ƒ, " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¤à¥ à¤ªà¤à¥à¤šà¤®à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤¹à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤µà¤¾à¤ªà¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·- ADHYAYA III, PADA I TADANTARAPRATIPATTYADHIKARANA 1

  1. Tadantarapratipattan ramhati samparigvaktaly, prasnanirupanabhyam In obtaining another of that, he goes embraced as understood from question and explantion. The self, when going from one body to another, goes embraced by the subtle rudiments of the elements. This is known from the question and answer recorded in the Pan- cÄgnividyÄ (ChÄnd. V-3-3). The question is this : - ’ Do you know why in the fifth oblation water becomes to be called ’ person’ ? The reply is this :- Thus indeed in the fifth ’ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¤¿à¤ªà¤¸à¥Œ A 1, M1. ‘à¤¦à¥‡à¤¹à¤¾à¤¤à¥ omitted M 1. [à¥§] à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥¨à¥©à¥­ à¤µà¤šà¤¸à¥‹ à¤­à¤µà¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¤¿à¤µà¤šà¤¨à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤¤à¤¯à¥‹à¤°à¥à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥ˆà¤ƒ à¤¸à¥‚à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥ˆà¤°à¤°à¥à¤¥à¥‹à¤½à¤­à¤¿à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤œà¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ à¤¸ à¤šà¤¾à¤¯à¤®à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤ƒ - à¤œà¥€à¤µà¥‹ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¹à¥à¤®à¤£à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¦à¥‡à¤¹à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¥‹ ‘à¤¯à¤¾à¤—à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¥ ’ ’ à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤«à¤²- à¤­à¥‹à¤—à¤¾à¤¯à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤¦à¥‡à¤¹à¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤¤à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¯ à¤—à¤šà¥à¤›à¤¨à¥, à¤à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤¦à¥‡à¤¹à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤¸à¤‚à¤¸à¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤ƒ à¤¸à¥‚à¤•à¥à¤·à¥à¤®à¤¾ - à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤°à¤¦à¥à¤­à¤¿à¤ƒ ‘à¤¸à¤‚à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤µà¤•à¥à¤¤à¥‹à¤½à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨ ‘à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¿à¤¤à¤‚ à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¥à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤¯, à¤¤à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤°à¥‡à¤µà¤¾- à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¤®à¤¯à¤¦à¥‡à¤¹à¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤£à¤¤à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤°à¤¦à¥à¤­à¤¿à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤µà¤•à¥à¤¤à¥‹ à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤‚ ‘à¤¶à¥‡à¤·à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤®à¥à¤ªà¤—à¤®à¥à¤¯, à¤¤à¥ˆà¤ƒ à¤¸à¤¹ à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤­à¥‹à¤—à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤­à¥‚à¤¯, à¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤µà¤¸à¤¾à¤¨à¥‡ à¤­à¥à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤¶à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¹à¥à¤®à¤£à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¯à¥‹à¤¨à¤¿à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ªà¤•à¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¤£à¤¾ oblation water becomes to be called ’ person’ (ChÄnd. V-9-1 ). The purport of the question and answer is indicated in the subsequent Sutras. The purport is this- The individual selves enveloped with the bodies of BrÃ¤hmann etc. perform the sacrifice, gifts etc. Then in order to enjoy the fruits. of these actions in other world, he starts from this body for other world. Then being embraced with water of the subtle state mixed with the redimentary other elements he reaches the heaven (dyuloka), that has been mentioned figuratively as fire. There he becomes embraced with the water that becomes modified into the body of the nature of Amá¹›ta (deathlessness) and becomes subservient to the gods. There he enjoys the fruits of his actions along with the gods. When his Karmans are practically exhausted he becomes born again in the world of Karman, as BrÄhmaá¹‡a, etc. along with a portion of his unspent Karmans which effects. 1 à¤¤à¤¯à¥‹: omitted M 2, Pr. 8 à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾ M 1. # à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤¦à¥‡à¤¹à¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤¤à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¯ M 1. 1 à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¿à¤¤ M 3, à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¿à¤¤à¤‚ Pr. â— à¤¶à¥‡à¤·à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¤‚ A 1, M 1. ? à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¹à¤¾ M 2, Pr. à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤«à¤², A 1, M 1. â€¢ à¤¸à¤‚ omitted A 1, M 2. à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤­à¤¿: A1.à¥¨à¥©à¥® à¤µà¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. à¤¸à¤¹ à¤ªà¥à¤¨à¤°à¤ªà¥€à¤®à¤‚ ‘à¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¤®à¤¾à¤—à¤¸à¥à¤¯, à¤•à¤°à¥à¤® à¤•à¤°à¥à¤¤à¥à¤‚ à¤¤à¤¾à¤®à¤¿à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤µà¤•à¥à¤¤à¥‹à¤½à¤­à¤¿à¤¸à¥à¤µ- à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¿à¤¤à¤‚ à¤ªà¤°à¥à¤œà¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤¯, à¤µà¤°à¥à¤·à¤§à¤¾à¤°à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤¹à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¿à¤¤à¤¾à¤‚ à¤ªà¥ƒà¤¥à¤¿à¤µà¥€à¤®à¥à¤ªà¤—à¤®à¥à¤¯, à¤µà¥à¤°à¥€à¤¹à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¸à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤¨ à¤¸à¤‚à¤¯à¥à¤œà¥à¤¯, à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤£à¤¤à¥‡à¤¨’ à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤£à¤¤à¥‡à¤¨ à¤¤à¥‡à¤¨ à¤¸à¤¹à¤¾à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¿à¤¤à¤‚ ’ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤¯ à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤¶à¥à¤•à¥à¤²à¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤£à¤¤à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤°à¤¦à¥à¤­à¤¿à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤µà¤•à¥à¤¤à¥‹à¤½à¤—à¥à¤­à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤µ- à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¿à¤¤à¤¾’ à¤¯à¥‹à¤·à¤¿à¤¤à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤¯, à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤—à¤°à¥à¤­à¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤£à¤¤à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤°à¤¦à¥à¤­à¤¿à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤· à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤²à¤ªà¤¨à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤µà¤•à¥à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤‚ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¹à¥à¤®à¤£à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¥‡à¤£ à¤œà¤¾à¤¯à¤¤ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¥ à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤•à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥ à¤­à¥‚à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥¨ à¥¥ 8 the birth as Brahmana etc. In order to perform Karmans again, being embraced with the water he enters the Parjanya (clouds) imagined as fire. In the form of rain he enters the earth imagined as fire. Then he becomes united with Vrihi (paddy) etc. which is subsequently transformed as food. Then along with the food, he enters the person who is imagined as fire. There he along with that water which. is transformed as S’ukla (semen virile) enter the woman imagined as fire. There being embraced with that trans- formed water that subsequently take the formation of the Garbha or womb and will be later known as person (man or woman) is born as Brahmana etc. according to his Karman.
  2. Tryatmakatvat tu bhÅ«yastvat But on account (of water) consisting of the three elements: because there is the predominance (of watery part in it). 1 à¤•à¤°à¥à¤® omitted M 1, 2. # à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¿à¤¤à¤¾à¤‚ A 1. à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¿à¤¤à¤ªà¥ƒà¤¥à¤¿à¤µà¥€ Pr. # à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¿à¤¤à¤‚ M 2, Pr. ‘à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¿à¤¤à¤¾à¤‚ A. 1 Pr. à¤†à¤—à¤®à¥à¤¯, M 1, Pr. à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤£à¤¤à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤¹ M 1. ara: omitted A 1.
  • à¤¤à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤°à¤¦à¥à¤­à¤¿à¤ƒ omitted M 2, 3. è¡Œ à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥¨à¥©à¥¯ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤µà¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤•à¤°à¤£à¥‡à¤¨ à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤•à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤¸à¤‚à¤¸à¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¾ à¤à¤µà¤¾à¤ªà¥‹ à¤­à¥‚à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡- à¤¨à¤¾à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¥‡à¤¨à¥‹à¤šà¥à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥‡ || à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤—à¤¤à¥‡à¤¶à¥à¤š à¥¥ à¥© à¥¥ " à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥à¤•à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤‚ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤¾ à¤…à¤¨à¥‚à¤¤à¥à¤•à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¥‡à¤¨ à¤¸à¤¹à¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤—à¤¤à¥‡à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¦à¤¾à¤¶à¥à¤°à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨ à¤¦à¥‡à¤¹à¤—à¤®à¤¨à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ ’ à¥¥ à¤…à¤—à¥à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤—à¤¤à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤°à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¨, à¤­à¤¾à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥ª à¥¥ All objects consist of the three elements due to Trivá¹›t- karana. But the water, through mixed with other elements is called water; because there is a predominence of watery part in it.
  1. Pranagates’ca And on account of the going out of the Praá¹‡as (with the individual selves). When the PrÄna (the self) departs from ( the body) all the PrÄnas pass away following him’ ( Bh. IV 4-2 ) The sense-organs pass out the body along with the individual self. It is. therefore, apprehended that the sense organs depart from the body along with the subtle form of the body which is the seat of them.
  2. Agnyadigatisruteriti cenna, bhaktatvat If it be said that it is not so on account of scriptural statement as to their going to Agni (fire) etc; we say no; on account of the secondary nature of the statement. 1 M 2, adds after ’ à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¤š à¤®à¤¨à¤ƒà¤·à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¾à¤¨à¥€à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾à¤£à¥€à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¤¾ à¥¤ à¥¨à¥ªà¥¦ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°à¤ƒ [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. " à¤…à¤­à¤¿ à¤µà¤¾à¤—à¤ªà¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤¤à¤¿" à¤‡à¤¤à¥€à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾à¤£à¤¾à¤®à¤—à¥à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤—à¤¤à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤°à¥à¤¨ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¥‡à¤¨ à¤¸à¤¹ ’ à¤—à¤®à¤¨à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¤à¥; à¤¨, à¤µà¤¾à¤—à¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤­à¤¿à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¿à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤¤à¤¾à¤¸à¥ à¤­à¤¾à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤—à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤®à¥ ; " à¤“à¤·à¤§à¥€à¤°à¥à¤²à¥‹à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¿ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¨à¤ªà¤¿à¤¯à¤¦à¥à¤­à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤²à¥‹à¤®à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤­à¤¿à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤¹ à¤ªà¤¾à¤ à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¥‡à¤½à¤¶à¥à¤°à¤µà¤£à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¨, à¤¤à¤¾ à¤à¤µ à¤¹à¥à¤¯à¥à¤ªà¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¥«à¥¥ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¥‡ ‘à¤§à¥à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¤¾ à¤®à¤¿à¤¹à¥‹à¤®à¥‡à¤½à¤ªà¤¾à¤®à¤¶à¥à¤°à¤µà¤£à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¾à¤ªà¥‹ à¤—à¤šà¥à¤›à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ ; â€œ à¤à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤®à¥Œ à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤¾à¤ƒ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤¾à¤‚ à¤œà¥à¤¹à¥à¤µà¤¤à¤¿" à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¤¦à¥à¤§à¥ˆà¤µ ‘à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¤à¥; à¤¨; à¤†à¤ª à¤à¤µ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤¾- C 6 As the texts, when the speech of the dead goes into fire’ (Bh. III. 2-13) etc. declare that when a person dies, his organs go into fire, etc. Hence they do not accompany the individual selves. This question is not correct. Here the words, speech etc., have the secondary meaning, namely the divinities (Agni etc.) who preside over them; because the text continues to sayThe hairs of the body enter into the herbs’. (Brh. III. 2-13). The hairs do not enter with the visible form into the herbs.
  3. PrathamesravaÅ†aditi cenna, ta eva hyupapattel Should it be said, on account of the absence of mention of the water in the first instance the waters do not go; we say no; for just that is meant, on the ground of appropriateness. The waters do not go with the individual selves, because the scriptural texts do not mention waters in the first instance (in the fire of heavens). In the scriptural text, ’ Into that fire, the Devas (senses ) offer SraddhÄ as oblation ’ (ChÄnd. V. 4-2 ) we understand that only the word, S’raddha is used. It is not * à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¥à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¥‡, M 1. Â·?] à¥¨à¥ªà¥§ à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤¾ à¤µà¤¾ à¤†à¤ªà¤ƒ à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¥‡à¤¨à¥‹à¤šà¥à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¤ à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤ªà¥à¤¸à¥ à¤ªà¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¾à¤¸à¥ à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‹à¤ªà¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤°à¥à¤—à¤®à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¹à¤¿’ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥‚à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¥ à¤…à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¨, à¤‡à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¾à¤µà¤¿à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤¿à¤£à¤¾à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥€à¤¤à¥‡à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¥¬ à¥¥ à¤…à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¶à¥à¤¨à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¤¿à¤µà¤šà¤¨à¤¯à¥‹à¤°à¤¾à¤ª à¤à¤µ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥‡ ; à¤¨ à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤µà¤•à¥à¤¤à¥‹ à¤œà¥€à¤µ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¤à¥ ; à¤¨, à¤‰à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤° â€œ à¤…à¤¥ à¤¯ à¤‡à¤®à¥‡ à¤—à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤® à¤‡à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¾à¤ªà¥‚à¤°à¥à¤¤à¥‡ à¤¦à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥à¤ªà¤¾à¤¸à¤¤à¥‡ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¾- à¤µà¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤¿à¤£à¤¾à¤‚ à¤—à¤®à¤¨à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤µà¤šà¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¤ à¤§à¥à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤¸à¤‚à¤¬à¤¨à¥à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¤µà¤¾à¤šà¥à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¯ so. Only water is meant by the word, S’raddha, because to the question relating to the water, the reply must be on the water itsef. This reply is sensible only if the water is meant by the word SraddhÄ. There is scriptural text also ’ Sraddha, indeed, is water ’ ( Tait. BrÄh. III. 2-4-1).
  4. Asrutatvaditi cenna, istadikarinam pratiteh If it be said that the self is not stated in the scrip- ture; way say â€˜it is not so ‘; because those, who perform sacrifice etc, have been understood there. If it is said that water alone is understood by the question and answer in this context and not the individual selves, that are embraced by the subtle rudimentary elements; we say it is not so; because in a subsequent passage of the text is men- tioned the route taken by those selves who perform the sacrifices etc. The text is this-‘But those who in the village perform sacrifices, dig wells, etc. and grant gifts’ (ChÄnd. V. 10-3). There is another scriptural text ‘By that oblation he becomes King Soma’ (Chand. V. 4-2). Here that, who is denoted by the word ’ water ’ connected with the fire of Dyuloka (the heavens), à¤¹à¤¿ omitted M 1, Pr. 31 à¥¨à¥ªà¥¨ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: [ à¤…à¤§à¤¿. à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾ à¤†à¤¹à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤ƒ à¤¸à¥‹à¤®à¥‹ à¤°à¤¾à¤œà¤¾ à¤¸à¤‚à¤­à¤µà¤¤à¤¿" à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¸à¥‹à¤®à¤­à¥‚à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¥ˆà¤µ “à¤¸à¥‹à¤®à¥‹ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤­à¤¿à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¦à¤¦à¥à¤­à¤¿à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤µà¤•à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤šà¥à¤›à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤• à¤à¤µà¤¾à¤ª à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥à¤šà¥à¤¯à¤¤ à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤µà¤—à¤®à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¥ à¤°à¤¾à¤œà¤¾ à¤­à¤¾à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤‚ à¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥; à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾à¤¹à¤¿ à¤¦à¤°à¥à¤¶à¤¯à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¥ à¥­ à¥¥ à¤à¤· à¤¸à¥‹à¤®à¥‹ à¤°à¤¾à¤œà¤¾; à¤¤à¤‚ à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤¾ à¤­à¤•à¥à¤·à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¸à¥‹à¤®à¤¾à¤ªà¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¥ˆà¤°à¥à¤­à¤•à¥à¤·à¥à¤¯à¤®à¤¾à¤£à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤µà¤šà¤¨à¤‚ à¤­à¤¾à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤®à¥ ; à¤…à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨ à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¥‹à¤ªà¤•à¤°à¤£à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¯à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾à¤¹à¤¿ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¿:- " à¤¯à¤¥à¤¾ à¤ªà¤¶à¥à¤°à¥‡à¤µà¤‚ à¤¸ à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤®à¥” à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¤¶à¥à¤µà¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¥‹à¤ªà¤•à¤°à¤£à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤‚ is mentioned as becoming the King Soma. The same that has assumed the state of King Soma is recognised in the scriptural text ‘King Soma’ (Chand. V. 10-4). Therefore by the word, water, is meant the individual self, who is embraced with the water and has it for his body. This is what is understood in the scriptural texts.
  5. Bhaktam vanatmavittvat; tatha hi darsayati Or this reference is metaphorical; because of their not knowing the Self. Indeed thus the scripture declares. # ’ He becomes Soma King ; Him the gods eat ’ (ChÄnd. V. 10-4). Here the eating by the gods of the self who has become as King Soma, must be taken metaphorically. The idea is that he becomes the means of enjoyment of the gods; because he is other than the realizer of the Self. Accord- ingly it has been stated in the text ‘He is like an animal for the gods,’ (Brh. 1-4-10). This statement reveals that he is the means of enjoyment of the gods. The followingà«¨] à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥¨à¥ªà¥© à¤¦à¤°à¥à¤¶à¤¯à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¤ à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤µà¤¿à¤¦à¤¾à¤®à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤µà¤¿à¤¦à¤¾à¤‚ à¤š à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¥‹à¤ªà¤•à¤°à¤£à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤‚ à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¥‹à¤ªà¤•à¤°à¤£à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤‚ à¤š à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ " à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¥ à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤¯à¤œà¥‹ à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ à¤®à¤¦à¥à¤­à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤¾ à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ à¤®à¤¾à¤®à¤ªà¤¿ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¥ à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥ à¥¨ à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¯à¥‡à¤½à¤¨à¥à¤¶à¤¯à¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¥ à¤¦à¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¸à¥à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¿à¤­à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤‚ à¤¯à¤¥à¥‡à¤¤à¤®à¤¨à¥‡à¤µà¤‚ à¤š à¥¥ à¥® à¥¥ à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¤£à¥‹à¤½à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥‡ à¤¨à¤¿à¤µà¤°à¥à¤¤à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¥‹ à¤­à¥à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤¶à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿ à¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¿à¤µà¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¤ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¿- à¤¸à¥à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¿à¤­à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¤µà¤—à¤®à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ â€œ à¤°à¤®à¤£à¥€à¤¯à¤šà¤°à¤£à¤¾ à¤°à¤®à¤£à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤‚ à¤¯à¥‹à¤¨à¤¿à¤®à¤¾à¤ªà¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥‡ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤ƒ à¥¤ 1 Smrti text also says that the realizers of the Self and the non- realizers of the Self are means of enjoyment of the Highest Person and of the gods respectively-Those, who worship the gods go unto the gods and those, who worship Me, go unto Me’ (Bha. Gi. VII. 23- 7 ) . Ká¹šTATYAYADHIKARAÅ…A 2
  6. Krtatyayenusayavan dá¹›á¹£á¹­asmá¹›tibhyam yathetamanevaá¹ ca On the exhaustion of the Karmans, the selves descend with a remainder of Karman, according to the Vedic texts and Smrtis. The descent is by the same route of the ascent and also not so. It is understood by the scriptures and the Smá¹›tis that on the exhaustion of Karmans, the self returns to this world with a remainder of the Karman whose fruits he has not enjoyed. The scriptural text is this â€” Those, whose deeds are good, are born in good families’ (Chand. V. 10-7). The Smrti texts à¥¨à¥ªà¥ª à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. à¤¤à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤µà¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥Œ à¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¤«à¤²à¤¶à¥‡à¤·à¥‡à¤£ à¤œà¤¾à¤¤à¤¿à¤‚ à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤®à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤•à¤¾ à¤¸à¥à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¿à¤ƒ à¥¤ ‘à¤†à¤°à¥‹à¤¹à¤£à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¥‡à¤£ à¤®à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤—à¥ˆà¤•à¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¥‡,’ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥‡à¤£ à¤šà¥ˆà¤•à¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¥‡ ’ à¥¥ à¤šà¤°à¤£à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¨ à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤ªà¤²à¤•à¥à¤·à¤£à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¥à¥‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤•à¤¾à¤·à¥à¤°à¥à¤£à¤¾à¤œà¤¿à¤¨à¤¿à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¥¯ à¥¥ à¥¯à¥¥ " à¤°à¤®à¤£à¥€à¤¯à¤šà¤°à¤£à¤¾à¤ƒ" à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¤°à¤£à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¨ à¤¸à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¶à¤¯à¤ƒ, à¤šà¤°à¤£à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤šà¤¾à¤°à¤µà¤¿à¤·à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¤à¥; à¤¨; à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¶à¤¯à¥‹à¤ªà¤²à¤•à¥à¤·à¤£à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¾ ‘à¤šà¤°à¤£à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤ƒ, à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¥ˆà¤µ ‘à¤¸à¥à¤–à¤¦à¥à¤ƒà¤–à¤¸à¤¾à¤§à¤¨à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ are these- Afterwards when a man returns to this world, he obtains, by virtue of a remainder of Karman, birth, form ’ (Äpa. Dha. SÅ«tra II. 1, 2, 3 ) and so on. The descent takes place partly through the route of ascent and partly by a different route.
  7. Caraá¹‡aditi cenna, tadupalaká¹£aá¹‡Ärtheti Kará¹£á¹‡Äjiniá¸¥ Should it be said that it is not so on account of the term Caraá¹‡a; not so, since Carana connotes the Karman also: thus KarÅŸá¹‡ajini thinks. The word, Carana, occurring in the passage Those, whose deeds are good’ does not mean the remainder of Karman, because it is generally used in the sense of SmartÄcÄra (i.e., general conduct, described in the Smá¹›tis). Therefore the self is not followed by the remainder of his Karman. This is not so. In the scriptural text the term Carana connotes the remainder of Karman also; because the pleasure and grief are the result of such Karman only. à¤†à¤°à¥‹à¤¹à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¥‡à¤£ Pr. à¤¦à¥‡à¤¶: A 1. Pr. à¤†à¤šà¤¾à¤° MI.Pr. à¤¦à¥‡à¤¶: A 1, Pr. 4 6 à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¶à¤¯: Pr. ‘à¤¸à¥à¤–à¤¸à¤¾à¤§à¤¨à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥ A 1, MI, Pr. à¥¨] à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥¨à¥ªà¥« à¤†à¤¨à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤•à¥à¤¯à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¨ à¤¤à¤¦à¤ªà¥‡à¤•à¥à¤·à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥§à¥¦ à¥¥ à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤šà¤¾à¤°à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤ªà¤¯à¥‹à¤—à¤¾à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤•à¥à¤¯à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¤à¥; à¤¨, à¤¤à¤¦à¤ªà¥‡à¤•à¥à¤·à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¯ ; à¤¸à¤‚à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¹à¥€à¤¨à¥‹à¤½à¤¶à¥à¤šà¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¨à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤®à¤¨à¤°à¥à¤¹à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¤¸à¥ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤µà¤š- à¤ªà¥à¤£à¥à¤¯à¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¤£à¤ƒ à¤¨à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤£à¤¾à¤œà¤¿à¤¨à¤¿à¤®à¤¤à¤®à¥ à¥¥ à¤¸à¥à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤·à¥à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¥‡ à¤à¤µà¥‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¤à¥ à¤¬à¤¾à¤¦à¤°à¤¿à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¥§à¥§ à¥¥ ‘à¤°à¤®à¤£à¥€à¤¯à¤šà¤°à¤£à¤¾à¤ƒ, à¤•à¤ªà¥‚à¤¯à¤šà¤°à¤£à¤¾à¤ƒ’ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¤°à¤£à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¥‡à¤¨ à¤¸à¥à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤·à¥à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¥‡ à¤à¤µà¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤§à¥€à¤¯à¥‡à¤¤à¥‡, ’ ’ à¤ªà¥à¤£à¥à¤¯à¤‚ à¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤šà¤°à¤¤à¤¿’ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¸à¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤§à¥‡à¤°à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ ‘à¤¬à¤¾à¤¦à¤°à¤¿à¤ƒ à¥¤
  8. Anarthakyamiti cenna, tadapekgatvat Should it be said that there is no purpose; it is not so, on account of the dependence of Karman on the conduct â€¢ No purpose is served as there is no use of the conduct mentioned in the Smá¹›tis. It is not so; because all the good works are dependent on the conduct. Because it is stated thus - ’ He, who does not worship SandhyÄ, is always impure, and he is unfit for any religious work’. This is the view of KÄrsnÄjini.
  9. SukrtaduÅŸkrte eveti tu Badaril But Badari thinks that the word Caraá¹‡a means good and evil works only. The word, Carana, occurring in the text Ramaniya - caraá¹‡aá¸¥ and ‘KapÅ«ya-caraá¹‡aá¸¥’ means good and evil actions as evident from the usage’ he does the works of good nature.’ This has been opined by Badari. SÅ«trakÄra accepts this view à¤­à¤—à¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¥ à¤¬à¤¾à¤¦à¤°à¤¿: M 1. 1 à¤…à¤­à¤¿à¤·à¥‡à¤µà¥‡ M 1. à¥¨à¥ªà¥¬ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. à¤à¤¤à¤¦à¥‡à¤µ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¥€à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤šà¤¾à¤°à¤¾à¤ªà¥‡à¤•à¥à¤·à¤‚ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤£à¥à¤¯à¤‚ à¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¥‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤š à¤¸à¥à¤µà¥€à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¤®à¥ à¥¥ à¤…à¤¨à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¯ à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥ à¥© à¤…à¤¨à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤¿à¤£à¤¾à¤®à¤ªà¤¿ à¤š à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤®à¥ à¥¥ à¤‡à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¾à¤ªà¥‚à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤¯ à¤•à¥à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¤à¤¾à¤®à¤ªà¤¿ à¤šà¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤—à¤®à¤¨à¤®à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¤ “à¤¯à¥‡ à¤µà¥ˆ à¤•à¥‡ à¤šà¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤²à¥à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¤¾- à¤¸à¥à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤®à¤¸à¤®à¥‡à¤µ à¤¤à¥‡ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‡ à¤—à¤šà¥à¤›à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥‡à¤·à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¤¸à¤‚à¤¯à¤®à¤¨à¥‡ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¨à¥à¤­à¥‚à¤¯à¥‡à¤¤à¤°à¥‡à¤·à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤°à¥‹à¤¹à¤¾à¤µà¤°à¥‹à¤¹à¥Œ, à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤—à¤¤à¤¿- à¤¦à¤°à¥à¤¶à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥§à¥© à¥¥ only. He also accepts that all the works of meritorious nature are based on the conduct, prescribed in the Smá¹›tis. ANIá¹¢TÄ€DIKARYADHIKARAá¹†A 3
  10. Anistadikarinamapi ca srutam Even for those who do not perform the sacrifice, etc. the ascent is declared by scriptures. Even they, who do not perform the sacrifices and do not dig wells etc. reach the moon. This is stated in the scriptural text, ’ All, who depart from this world go to the moon’ (Kaus. 1-9 ) .

Samyamane tvanubhuyetaresamarohavarohan, tad. gatidarsanat But as regards others, after experiencing the results in the world of Samyamana (the god of death), there is ascent and descent; as such a course has been declared in the scriptures. à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‡ à¤—à¤šà¥à¤›à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ omitted M 1, Pr. à¥©] à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¤‡à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¾à¤ªà¥‚à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤¯ à¤•à¥à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¤à¤¾à¤‚ à¤¯à¤®à¤¸à¤¦à¤¨à¥‡ à¤¯à¤®à¤¸à¤¦à¤¨à¥‡ à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤«à¤²à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤­à¥‚à¤¯à¤¾à¤°à¥‹à¤¹à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿, à¤¸à¤‚à¤—à¤®à¤¨à¤®à¥” à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¥Œ à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤—à¤¤à¤¿à¤¦à¤°à¥à¤¶à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ $ à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤°à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ à¤š à¥¥ à¥§à¥ª à¥¥ " à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‡ à¤šà¥ˆà¤¤à¥‡ à¤µà¤¶à¤‚ à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¯à¤®à¤¸à¥à¤¯ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿ à¥¥ à¤…à¤ªà¤¿ à¤¸à¤ªà¥à¤¤ à¥¥ à¥§à¥« à¥¥ à¤¸à¤ªà¥à¤¤ à¤°à¥Œà¤°à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¥€à¤¨à¤ªà¤¿ à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤°à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¥ à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ªà¤¿ à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¯à¤¾à¤ªà¤¾à¤°à¤¾à¤¦à¤µà¤¿à¤°à¥‹à¤§à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¥§à¥¬ à¥¥ à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ªà¤¿ à¤¯à¤®à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤ªà¤¾à¤°à¤¾à¤¦à¥‡à¤µ à¤¯à¤®à¤µà¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¤¾à¤¯à¤¾ à¤…à¤µà¤¿à¤°à¥‹à¤§à¤ƒ | à¥¨à¥ªà¥­ 1 " à¤µà¥ˆà¤µà¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¤à¤‚ But they, who do not perform the sacrifice, etc., experi- ence the results of their Karmans in the kingdom of Yama.   15. VidyakarmaÅ†oriti tu prakrtatvat But of the knowledge and the Karman; on account of those being in the context. The fruits derived from knowledge and Karman are the attainments of the Brahman and the moon respectively. How is this? This is because of the following scriptural texts- â€¢ Those who know thus, reach the light’ (Chand. V-10-1). â€¢ Those, who perform the sacrifices, dig wells etc. and give the gifts, reach the smoke ’ (ChÄnd. V-10- 3 ). Hence, those, who do Papakarmans (evil actions) do not traverse that route after death.

  • à¤¦à¥‡à¤¹à¤¾à¤°à¤®à¥à¤­à¤¾à¤¯ à¤¯à¥à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¤—à¤®à¤¨à¤¾à¤ªà¥‡à¤•à¥à¤·à¤¾ M 1. à¥©] à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥¨à¥ªà¥¯ à¤§à¥à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¤—à¤®à¤¨à¤¾à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¥‹à¤ªà¤²à¤¬à¥à¤§à¥‡à¤ƒ " à¤…à¤¥à¥ˆà¤¤à¤¯à¥‹à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¥à¥‹à¤°à¥à¤¨ à¤•à¤¤à¤°à¥‡à¤£à¤šà¤¨ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤°à¤­à¥à¤¯ " à¤à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤‚ à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¤‚ à¤¤à¥‡à¤¨à¤¾à¤¸à¥Œ à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¥‹ à¤¨ à¤¸à¤‚à¤ªà¥‚à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¤ à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¤¾à¤ªà¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤£ à¤‰à¤šà¥à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¥ à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¥ à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡à¤½à¤ªà¤¿ à¤š à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¥‡ à¥¥ à¥§à¥¯ à¥¥ à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¥‡ à¤š à¤¦à¥à¤°à¥Œà¤ªà¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¥€à¤¨à¤¾à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤£à¥à¤¯à¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¤£à¤¾à¤®à¤ªà¤¿ à¤ªà¤à¥à¤šà¤®à¤¾ à¤¹à¥à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¨à¤ªà¥‡à¤•à¥à¤·à¤¦à¥‡à¤¹à¤¾à¤°à¤®à¥à¤­à¤ƒ ’ à¤¦à¤°à¥à¤¶à¤¨à¤¾à¤š à¥¥ à¥¨à¥¦ à¥¥ the world of the moon, in order to reach Dyuloka (the heavens ) ; because it is apprehended that they do not go to the Dyuloka at all. The text begins with, ‘Then of these two paths, they do not go by either ’ and ends with, ’ This is the third place. That world is not filled by this’ (ChÄnd. V-10-8). By the words ’the third place, are stated the PÄpakarmans (those who commit evil deeds).

  3. Trtiyasabdavarodhak samsokajasya The third term includes that which springs from The meaning is this- That which springs from sweat, is to be included in those denoted by the term Udbhijja (born from the sprout). TATSVÄ€BHAVYAPATTYADHIKARANA 4

Tatsvabhavyapattirupapatteh There is entering into similarity with those things, there being a reason. à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾à¤š M. 3. à¥ª, à¥« ] à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥¨à¥«à¥§ " à¤¯à¤¥à¥‡à¤¤à¤®à¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤¶à¤®à¥ " " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤¶à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¸à¤¾à¤¦à¥ƒà¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤µ à¤°à¥‹à¤¹à¤¤ à¤‰à¤ªà¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡, à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤¸à¥à¤–à¤¦à¥à¤ƒà¤–à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤­à¤µà¤¾à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¥‹à¤ªà¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤ƒ’ à¥¤ à¤¤à¤¦à¤¨à¥à¤­à¤µà¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¥à¥‡ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤šà¥à¤›à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤¤à¤¾ à¥¥ à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¤¿à¤šà¤¿à¤°à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥ à¥« à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¤¿à¤šà¤¿à¤°à¥‡à¤£ à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥‡à¤·à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥¨à¥© à¥¥ à¤µà¥à¤°à¥€à¤¹à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤—à¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤¶à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥ à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¤¿à¤šà¤¿à¤°à¤‚ à¤¤à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¤ à¤–à¤²à¥ à¤¦à¥à¤°à¥à¤¨à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤ªà¤¤à¤°à¤®à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥€à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤¾à¤µà¥‡à¤µ à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥‡à¤·à¤µà¤šà¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ " " à¤…à¤¤à¥‹ à¤µà¥ˆ It is taught in the following scriptural text, that on the return journey the individual selves become similar to the ether etc.â€”’ As they went, they return into the ether, etc. (ChÄnd. V-10-5) because in those places there will not be the experience of pleasure and pain. Indeed, the individual selves take various forms in order to experience pleasure and pain. NATICIRADHIKARANA 5
  5. Naticirena visesat ( Duration of stay in ether, etc.) will not be long, on account of the special statement. 1 The individual selves do not remain long in ether etc., before they enter Vrihi etc. because there is special statement only as regards the Vrihi etc. The statement is this - ‘Therefore, verily indeed, it is very difficult to emerge’ (ChÄnd. V-10-6). 1 à¤†à¤¦à¤¿ omitted Pr. à¤¸à¥à¤–à¤¦à¥à¤ƒà¤–à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤­à¤µà¤¾à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¥‹à¤ªà¤ªà¤¤à¥‡: A 1. 2 à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤µà¤°à¥‹à¤¹à¥‡ M 1.
  • à¤…à¤¤à¥‹ à¤¹ à¤µà¥‡ M 1. à¥¨à¥«à¥¨ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤°à¤¿à¤ƒ à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¿à¤¤à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥ à¥¬ à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¿à¤¤à¥‡ à¤ªà¥‚à¤°à¥à¤µà¤µà¤¦à¤­à¤¿à¤²à¤¾à¤ªà¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥¨à¥ª à¥¥ .1 à¤…à¤§à¤¿. " à¤¤ à¤‡à¤¹ à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥€à¤¹à¤¿à¤¯à¤µà¤¾à¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¥Œ à¤šà¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¿à¤¤à¥‡ à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥€à¤¹à¤¿à¤¯à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¥Œ à¤¸à¤‚à¤¶à¥à¤²à¥‡à¤·à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤®à¥ à¤…à¤µà¤°à¥‹à¤¹à¤¤ à¤†à¤•à¤¾à¤¶à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤µ ‘à¤œà¤¨à¤¨ à¤¹à¥‡à¤¤à¥ à¤µà¤¿à¤°à¤¹à¤¿à¤¤à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤²à¤¾à¤ªà¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¤ " à¤œà¤¾à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥‡ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤µà¤šà¤¨à¤®à¥Œà¤ªà¤šà¤¾à¤°à¤¿à¤•à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤¯à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¹à¥à¤®à¤£à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤œà¤¨à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¿, à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤° " à¤°à¤®à¤£à¥€à¤¯à¤šà¤°à¤£à¤¾à¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¹à¤¿’ à¤¹à¥‡à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤­à¤¿à¤²à¤ªà¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¥ à¤…à¤¶à¥à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¨à¥à¤¨, à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥¨à¥« à¥¥ ANYADHIá¹¢THITADHIKARANA 6
  1. Anyadhisthite purvavadabhilapat He is connected with rice, grain etc. that are animated by other selves, because of the statement as in the previous cases. As the rice etc., are already animated by other selves, the descending selves, only cling to them as stated in the text, â€¢ They are born as rice, grain etc. (ChÄnd. V-10-6). It is because there is no mention of the cause of the birth as rice etc. just as in the case of the birth as the ether etc. The word, ‘born used therein must be taken in a metaphorical sense. Suppose they are born as BrÄhmaá¹‡as etc., then there is mentioned the cause of the birth in the text ’those of good deeds’, etc., (ChÄnd. V-10-7).
  2. Asuddhamiti cenna, s’abdat If it be said, it is impure ; not so, on account of the scriptural statements. 1 à¤œà¤®à¥à¤®à¤¹à¥‡à¤¤à¥ M 2, à¤œà¤¨à¤¿à¤¹à¥‡à¤¤à¥ A 1. #à¤¹à¤¿ omitted M 3.à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥¨à¥«à¥© à¤…à¤µà¤°à¥‹à¤¹à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥‚à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¿à¤¤à¤¯à¤¾à¤—à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤µà¤­à¥€à¤·à¥‹à¤®à¥€à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¦à¤¿à¤¹à¤¿à¤‚à¤¸à¤¾à¤—à¤°à¥à¤­à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨à¤¾à¤¶à¥à¤¦à¥à¤§à¤‚ à¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¤¾- à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥€à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¤à¥; à¤¨, â€œ à¤¹à¤¿à¤°à¤£à¥à¤¯à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤° à¤Šà¤°à¥à¤§à¥à¤µà¤ƒ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤°à¥à¤—à¥‡ à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¤®à¥‡à¤¤à¤¿ " " à¤¨ à¤µà¤¾ à¤‰ à¤µà¥‡à¤¤à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¸à¥‡ à¤¨ à¤°à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤¯à¤¸à¤¿ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¤¶à¥à¤¸à¤‚à¤œà¥à¤à¤ªà¤¨à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¹à¤¿à¤‚à¤¸à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¤°à¥‡à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤¿à¤—à¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤—à¥‹à¤½à¤¥ || à¥¨à¥¬ à¥¥ â€œà¤¯à¥‹ à¤¯à¥‹ à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤®à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¯à¥‹ à¤°à¥‡à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤¿à¤à¥à¤šà¤¤à¤¿ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¥‡à¤¨ à¤¸à¤‚à¤¸à¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤°à¥‡à¤¤ :- à¤¸à¤¿à¤šà¤¾ à¤¯à¥‹à¤—à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤®à¤¨à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤®à¥à¤šà¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ à¤…à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥‚à¤°à¥à¤µà¤®à¤ªà¤¿ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¥€à¤¹à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¯à¥‹à¤—à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤®à¥ || While descending, the individual selves descend with their impure actions; because when they performed sacrifices in former generations, they committed injury to living beings, that were offered in Agniá¹£oma and other sacrifices. It is not so. Slaughtering the animals in sacrifices is not of an injurious kind. This is stated in the text,’ with a golden. body, it goes up to the heavenly world;’ ‘By this action. you do not die, nor you become subject to injury’ (Tait. Brd. III-7-7).
  3. Retahsigyogotha After that, there is conjunction with him, who per. forms the act of generation. ‘Whoever eats the food and emits the semen, that being he becomes’ (Chand. V-10-6). Thus it is stated that after the conjunction with food, the self becomes con- junct with him who performs the act of generation. There- fore he becomes only connected with rice etc., even before that stage. à«¨à«¬à«ª à¤¬à¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: à¤¯à¥‹à¤¨à¥‡à¤ƒ à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤®à¥ à¥¥ à¥¨à¥­ à¥¥ à¤¯à¥‹à¤¨à¤¿ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¶à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤¾à¤µà¤°à¥‹à¤¹à¤¤à¤¾ à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¥ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥€à¤­à¤—à¤µà¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤œ à¤µà¤¿à¤°à¤šà¤¿à¤¤à¥‡ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°à¥‡ à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾- à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¥à¤®à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥¥ [ à¤…à¤§à¤¿.
  4. Yoneá¸¥ sariram From the womb the body. Only after having reached the womb, the descending soul obtains a body. THUS ENDS THE 1ST PADA OF THE 3RD ADHYAYA.

à¥¨

à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤‚à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤•à¤°à¤£à¤®à¥ à¥§ à¥¥ à¤¸à¤‚à¤§à¥à¤¯à¥‡ à¤¸à¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¿à¤°à¤¾à¤¹ à¤¹à¤¿ à¥¥ à¥§ à¥¥ à¤¸à¤‚à¤§à¥à¤¯à¥‡ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤ªà¥à¤¨à¥‡ " à¤…à¤¥ à¤°à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¥ à¤°à¤¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤—à¤¾à¤¨à¥ ‘à¤ªà¤¥à¤ƒ à¤¸à¥ƒà¤œà¤¤à¥‡ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¤¾à¤­à¤¿- à¤¹à¤¿à¤¤à¤¾ à¤¸à¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¿à¤°à¥à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¤¾ à¥¤ à¤ªà¥à¤·à¥à¤•à¤°à¤¿à¤£à¥à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤¸à¥à¤°à¤µà¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤¸à¥ƒà¤œà¤¤à¥‡ à¤¸ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤•à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¾ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤®à¤¦à¥ƒà¤¶à¤‚ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤®à¥‡à¤µ à¤•à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¹ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤ƒ à¥¥ ADHYAYA III, PÄ€DA II SAMDHYADHIKARANA 1

  1. Samdhye ststiraha hi In sleep, the scriptures state, there is creation. " The word ‘sandhya’ means ‘sleep’. The creation mentioned in the text, Then he creats chariots, horses, roads, etc. (Brh. IV. 3-10) is effected by the individual self. It is so, because the following scriptural text declares the individual self, the experiencer of the dream, as the creator of what he sees in the sleep-’ He creats the tanks and streams, as he is the creator ’ (Brh. IV. 3-10). à¤ªà¤¥à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤¬à¤¸à¥‡ omitted M 2, Pr. à¤¹à¤¿ omitted M 1, Pr. à¥¨à¥«à¥¬ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¤¾à¤°à¤‚ à¤šà¥ˆà¤•à¥‡ à¤ªà¥à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¦à¤¯à¤¶à¥à¤š à¥¥ à¥¨ à¥¥ [à¤…à¤˜à¤¿. " à¤¯ à¤à¤· à¤¸à¥à¤ªà¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤·à¥ à¤œà¤¾à¤—à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¿ à¤•à¤¾à¤®à¤‚ à¤•à¤¾à¤®à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¥‹ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤®à¤¾à¤£à¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤¨à¤‚ ’ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤‚ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¤¾à¤°à¤®à¥‡à¤•à¥‡ à¤¶à¤¾à¤–à¤¿à¤¨à¥‹à¤½à¤§à¥€à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ à¤…à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤•à¤¾à¤®à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¾à¤ƒ à¤•à¤¾à¤®à¥à¤¯à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¤à¤¯à¤¾ à¤ªà¥à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¦à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥‚à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¤à¥à¤° â€œà¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¥ à¤•à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤‚à¤¶à¥à¤›à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¤¤à¤ƒ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤•à¤¾à¤®- à¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¤¸à¥à¤¯ " à¤¶à¤¤à¤¾à¤¯à¥à¤·à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤ªà¥Œà¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¨à¥ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤µà¤¿à¤µà¥ƒà¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¤®à¤¾à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤‚ à¤¤à¥, à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¤à¥à¤¸à¥à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤¨à¤¾à¤¨à¤­à¤¿à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥© à¥¥ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤ªà¥à¤¨à¥‡ ‘à¤¯à¤¾ à¤°à¤¥à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¸à¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¿à¤ƒ, à¤¤à¤¦à¤¿à¤¦à¤®à¥€à¤¶à¥à¤µà¤°à¤•à¥ƒà¤¤à¤‚ à¤®à¤¾à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤®à¥" à¥¤ “à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤®-
  2. Nirmataram caike putradaysca And some state that the individual self is the creator and the objects of creation are the sons etc. The followers of some S’Ã¤khÃ¤ state, in their text, that the individual self is the creator of the objects experienced in dreams. The text is this â€” He is the person, who is awake among those that sleep and he is creating various KÄmas (desired objects)’, (Kath. II. 2-8). What are meant by the word KÄmas here are the sons etc. that are desired; because in the previous passage it is stated thus-Ask for all KÄmas according to your wish’. It is explained further thus’ Choose sons and grandsons living for hundred years’ (Kath. I. 1-23). 3. Mayamatram tu, kartsnyenanabhivyaktasvarupatvat But it is mere Maya; on account of his true nature not being fully manifested. The creation of chariot, etc., in dreams, is effected by the Lord and it is His Maya only. It is experienced only by the 1 From à¤à¤¨à¤‚ to à¤…à¤§à¥€à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ omitted M 1, 2. à¤¯à¤¾ omitted M 1. à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥à¤•à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾ M 1, Pr. à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤°à¤¶à¥‡à¤•à¥‡à¤¨ M 1. à¥§] à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¥¤ à¥¨à¥«à¥­ à¤¦à¥ƒà¤¶à¥ˆà¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤‚ à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤•à¤¾à¤²à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤µà¤¸à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¶à¥à¤šà¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¤¯à¤¾ à¤®à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤®à¥ à¥¤ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¯ ‘à¤¸à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¸à¤‚à¤•à¤²à¥à¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤•à¤‚ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¤¿à¤•à¤‚ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤‚ à¤¸à¤‚à¤¸à¤¾à¤°à¤¦à¤¶à¤¾à¤¯à¤¾à¤‚ à¤•à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤¸à¥à¤®à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¥à¤¸à¥à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤¨à¤¾à¤¨à¤­à¤¿à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤•à¥à¤¤- à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¨ à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¸à¤‚à¤•à¤²à¥à¤ªà¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤¸à¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¿à¤°à¥à¤ªà¤ªà¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¤ " à¤¸ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤•à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¾ " " à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¥‹ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤®à¤¾à¤£à¤ƒ " " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤š à¤¨ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤µà¤¿à¤·à¤¯à¤®à¥, " à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤¨à¥ à¤²à¥‹à¤•à¤ƒ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¤à¤¾à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¥‡ à¤¤à¤¦à¥ à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤•à¤¶à¥à¤šà¤¨ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤µà¤šà¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ ‘à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¤¿à¤•à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨à¤­à¤¿à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤•à¥à¤¤à¥Œ à¤¹à¥‡à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¹ ’ à¤ªà¤°à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥ à¤¤à¤¿à¤°à¥‹à¤¹à¤¿à¤¤à¤®à¥ ; à¤¤à¤¤à¥‹ à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¬à¤¨à¥à¤§à¤µà¤¿à¤ªà¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¯à¥Œ à¥¥ à¥ª à¥¥ person who is in dreams and the creation continues only as long as the dream lasts. Hence it is wonderful and is called MÄyÄ. True will etc. are the natural characteristics of the individual selves; however, these do not manifest themselves completely when the men are under the influence. of SamsÄƒra. Therefore the creation in dreams is not possible for the selves by their true will. The scriptural texts ‘He is the creator’ (Bh. IV-3-10 ) and ‘The person is creating ’ (Kath. II. 2-8), do not refer to the individual selves, because there is the following scriptural text in the same context, ‘On Him all the worlds do rest and no one exceeds Him’ (Kath. II-2-8). The next Sutra reveals the cause for the non-manifestation of the characteristics though they are natural to the selves:
  3. Parabhidhyanat tu tirohitam ; tato hyasya bandhaviparyayau 3 They are hidden on account of the will of the 1 à¤¸à¤¤à¥à¤¯ à¤¸à¤‚à¤•à¤²à¥à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤¿ M 1. ’ à¤š omitted M 1, 2. Pr. # à¤…à¤¨à¤­à¤¿à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤®à¤¾à¤¹ M 2. à¤¤à¤¦à¥ à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤•à¤¶à¥à¤šà¤¨ omitted A 1M 1.Pr. â€¢ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¤¿à¤•à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡ A 1. 33à¥¨à¥«à¥® à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. - à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤ªà¤šà¤¾à¤°à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤µà¤¾à¤¹à¥‡à¤£ à¤ªà¤°à¤¾à¤­à¤¿à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¦à¥‡à¤µ à¤¤à¤¿à¤°à¥‹à¤¹à¤¿à¤¤à¤®à¥, à¤¤à¤¦à¤ª- à¤šà¤¾à¤°à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤¤à¤¦à¤¨à¥à¤µà¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤ƒ à¥¤ à¤¤à¤¤à¥‹ à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¬à¤¨à¥à¤§à¤®à¥‹à¤•à¥à¤·à¥Œ,’ " à¤…à¤¥ à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤­à¤¯à¤‚ à¤­à¤µà¤¤à¤¿ " " à¤…à¤¥ à¤¸à¥‹à¤½à¤­à¤¯à¤‚ à¤—à¤¤à¥‹ à¤­à¤µà¤¤à¤¿ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤ƒ à¥¥ à¤¦à¥‡à¤¹à¤¯à¥‹à¤—à¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¾ à¤¸à¥‹à¤½à¤ªà¤¿ à¥¥ à¥« à¥¥ à¤¸à¥‹à¤½à¤ªà¤¿ à¤¤à¤¿à¤°à¥‹à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¥‹à¤½à¤ªà¤¿ à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤®à¤¨à¥à¤·à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¦à¥‡à¤¹à¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤¾à¤šà¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤—à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤¸à¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¿à¤¯à¥‡à¤²à¤¾- à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¥ ; à¤¨à¤¾à¤®à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤µà¤¿à¤­à¤¾à¤—à¤¾à¤¨à¤°à¥à¤¹à¤¸à¥‚à¤•à¥à¤·à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¤¾à¤šà¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤—à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤²à¤¯à¥‡ || Highest; because from Him start the bondage and its opposite state of the selves. The characteristics of the individual selves become concealed on account of the will of the Highest; because the individual selves have committed a series of wrongs, that has not a beginning. On account of the wrongs committed by the individual selves, the Lord’s will continues. Indeed, the bond - age and liberation of the self do follow His will. The scriptural authorities are these- Then there is fear for him ’ ( Tait. I- 2-7). Then he becomes free from fear ’ ( Tait. I-2-7 ).
  4. Dehayogad va sopi And that is due to the connection with the body. The concealment of the natural characteristics of the selves at the time of the creation is due to their connection with Acit (the non-sentient Prakrti ), that has assumed the form of the bodies of men, gods, etc. At the time of the Pralaya (the deluge ), the concealment is due to their con- nection with Acit (Praká¹›ti) that has assumed a subtle state which cannot be distinguished in name and form. 1 à¤µà¤¿à¤ªà¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¯à¥Œ M 3. Pr.
  • à¤…à¤ªà¤¿ omitted M I, 2.   1. Sucakasca hi srutel ; acakÅŸate ca tadvidah And it is suggestive according to scriptures; thus the knowers of the science of the dreams declare. Indeed, dreams indicate the future auspicious and inauspicious events. This is stated in the text-’ Then, if one sees the black person in dream.’ etc. Thus declare the knowers of the science of the dreams. Therefore the individual selves are not the creators of the objects seen in dreams. TADABHAVADHIKARAÅ…A 2

In mentioning thus, no contradiction arises, because the NÄá¸is, Puritat (Pericardium) and the Highest Self are places of rest in combination, like the palatial buildings, cot and sofa.

Yet the same person again rises at the time of waking, because he has to undergo the retribution of the works done previously by want of knowledge. Because also there is the remembrance of the incidents that took place previously. And because it is stated in the scriptural text, beginning with whatever they are here, whether a tiger, etc.’ and ending with ’ whatever they are, thus they become’ (ChÄnd. VI- 10-2 ) . And because otherwise the injunction of the means for attain- ing Moksa (final beatitude) would become meaningless. " " MUGDHADHIKARANA 4
  5. Mughderdhasampattih parisesat In a swooping person there is half-reaching the death; for this is the only course remaining. In a swooning person a certain state is seen. That state is known as half-reaching the death; because its cause and the form assumed, are distinct from those of other states. UBHAYALINGADHIKARAÅ…A 5
  6. Na sthanatopi parasyobhayalingaá¹ sarvatra hi Not, even on account of residing, is there any im- perfection in the Highest Self; for everywhere He is described as having two-fold characteristics. No imperfection arises in the Highest Self, even though He remains as an inner Ruler in the selves during the four states, such as the waking, etc. In the scriptures and in the Smá¹›tis it is heard that the Highest Self possesses the two fold characteristics, namely, the total absence of all the im- perfections and the possession of all good qualities. The texts are - He is free from evil and possesses true will’ (ChÄnd. VIII-1-5). ‘Without any stain’ (S’vet. 6-19). ‘He, who under- stands all and knows all’ (Mund. I-1-9). ‘He, in nature, is full of all the auspicious qualities’ (Vish. Pu. VI- 5-84). Where all evils, sufferings etc. do not exist ’ ( Vish. Pu. VI- 5-85). à¤…à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¤à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¸à¤®à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨ à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¿à¤¤à¥‡à¤°à¤ªà¤¿ M 1, à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤¸à¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨ A 1. ‘à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¤¸à¥à¤¤ à¤¨à¤¿à¤–à¤¿à¤²à¤¦à¥‹à¤·à¤¸à¤‚à¤¬à¤¨à¥à¤§à¤¤à¥à¤µ M 2, Pr.4] à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ à¤­à¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¨, à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤•à¤®à¤¤à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤šà¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥§à¥¨ à¥¥ à¥¨à¥¬à¥© à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¤à¥‹à¤½à¤ªà¤¹à¤¤à¤ªà¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤®à¤¨à¥‹à¤½à¤ªà¤¿ à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤¸à¤‚à¤¬à¤¨à¥à¤§à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤­à¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¥à¤¾ à¤¦à¥‹à¤·- à¤¸à¤‚à¤¬à¤¨à¥à¤§:, à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾ à¤ªà¤°à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤ªà¤¿ " à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤ªà¥ƒà¤¥à¤¿à¤µà¥€ à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤®à¥” à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤¸à¤‚à¤¬à¤¨à¥à¤§à¤¿- à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤¦à¥‹à¤· à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¥‡à¤¤à¥; à¤¨, " à¤¯à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤ªà¥ƒà¤¥à¤¿à¤µà¥€ à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤®à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤·à¥ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¤à¤¿à¤ªà¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¤‚ à¤¸ à¤¤ à¤†à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤®à¥à¤¯à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¤ƒâ€ à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¥‹à¤·à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤µà¤šà¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¤…à¤ªà¤¿ à¤šà¥ˆà¤µà¤®à¥‡à¤•à¥‡ à¥¥ à¥§à¥© à¥¥ à¤à¤•à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¿à¤¨à¥ à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°à¥‡à¤½à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¿à¤¤à¤¯à¥‹à¤°à¥à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤ªà¤°à¤¯à¥‹à¤°à¥à¤¯à¥‹ à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥‡à¤· à¤‰à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤ƒ ; à¤à¤µà¤®à¥‡à¤•à¥‡
  7. Bhedaditi cenna, pratyekamatadvacanat Should it be said on account of different states, the imperfections cling to Him; it is not so, because with reference to each of the states, the texts say that the evils are not in Him. The imperfections do cling to the individual selves, though they are in nature devoid of those imperfections; because the selves are connected with different bodies. In the same way the imperfections cling to the Highest Self also, as He is connected with bodies as stated in the text, ‘whose body is the earth’ (BÅ†h. V-7-3) and so on. It is not so. As regards the state- ment, â€” whose body is the earth’, there is the counter-statement, ’ He is Your Self, the inner controller and the immortal ’ ( Bh. III-7-3). This statement reveals that He is devoid of imperfections.
  8. Api caivameke Some also declare thus. The individual selves and the Highest self are encased in the same body. Yet their differential characteristics are à¥¨à¥¬à¥ª à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: [à¤…à¤§à¤¿. à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¶à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¥‡à¤¨à¤¾à¤§à¥€à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ - " à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¾ à¤¸à¥à¤ªà¤°à¥à¤£à¤¾" à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤°à¤­à¥à¤¯ " à¤ªà¤¿à¤ªà¥à¤ªà¤²à¤‚ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¨à¤¶à¥à¤¨- à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤½à¤­à¤¿à¤šà¤¾à¤•à¤¶à¥€à¤¤à¤¿" à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¥ à¤…à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤µà¤¦à¥‡à¤µ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤¤à¤¤à¥à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥§à¥ª à¥¥ à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤·à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°à¥‡à¤·à¥ à¤¶à¤°à¥€à¤°à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤½à¤ªà¤¿ à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤°à¤¹à¤¿à¤¤à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¦à¥‡à¤µ à¤µà¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¤à¥‡ à¤¤à¤¤à¥ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤®, ‘à¤¨à¤¾à¤®à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¯à¥‹à¤°à¥à¤¨à¤¿à¤µà¤¦à¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤µà¥‡à¤¨ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¤ à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾à¤¹à¤¿ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤ƒ – â€œ à¤¨à¤¾à¤®à¤°à¥‚à¤ª - à¤¯à¥‹à¤°à¥à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¹à¤¿à¤¤à¤¾ à¤¤à¥‡ à¤¯à¤¦à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤¾ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¤ à¤¨à¤¾à¤®à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¯à¥‹à¤°à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤¾ à¤…à¤¸à¥à¤ªà¥ƒà¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¥‹ à¤®à¤§à¥à¤¯à¥‡ à¤µà¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¤à¥‡ . à¤…à¤µà¤¶à¥à¤¯ à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤ƒ à¥¥ ; stated in the scriptures. Accordingly some texts state in clear words beginning with Two birds with beautiful wings’ and ending with ‘One of them eats the sweet Pippala fruit, while the other shines in splendour without eating at all’ (Mund. III-1-1).
  9. Ampavadeva hi, tatpradhanatvat The Brahman is altogether like without form, since He is the principal agent with regard to that. The Brahman behaves like a formless object, though He is the Soul, possessed with the bodies of men etc. He is the principal, as He gives names and forms for all objects. The authoritative scriptural text is thus-He is responsible for the name and Form; yet He remains aloof between them, (ChÃ¥nd. VIII-14). He remains aloof between them’ means ‘He is not connected with the name and form.’ The purport " " is He is not dependent to others.’ 1 à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤¨à¤¾à¤®à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¯à¥‹à¤°à¤ªà¤¿ M 2, 3. Pr. 9] à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥€à¤¯: à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦: à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤•à¤¾à¤¶à¤µà¤šà¥à¤šà¤¾à¤µà¥ˆà¤¯à¤°à¥à¤¥à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥§à¥« à¥¥ à¥¨à¥¬à¥« à¤¯à¤¥à¤¾ " à¤¸à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤‚ à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤µà¤¾à¤•à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤µà¥ˆà¤¯à¤°à¥à¤¥à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤ªà¥à¤°à¤•à¤¾à¤¶à¤¤à¤¯à¤¾ à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨- à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤‚ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤®, à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾ " à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¤µà¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤®à¥ " " à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤œà¥à¤à¤ƒ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥ "" à¤ªà¤°à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¶à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤µà¤¿à¤§à¥ˆà¤µ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥‚à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¤¿à¤•à¥€ à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¬à¤²à¤•à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾ à¤š" à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤ªà¤°à¤ƒà¤¶à¤¤- à¤µà¤¾à¤•à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤µà¥ˆà¤¯à¤°à¥à¤¥à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¤µà¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤‚ à¤•à¤²à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤£à¤—à¥à¤£à¤¾à¤•à¤°à¤‚ à¤šà¥‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥à¤­à¤¯à¤²à¤¿à¤™à¥à¤—à¤®à¥‡à¤µ à¥¥ " à¤†à¤¹ à¤š à¤¤à¤¨à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤®à¥ à¥¥ à¥§à¥¬ à¥¥ à¤¸à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤‚ à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤¤à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¹ à¥¤ à¤¨à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¿à¤µà¤¾à¤°à¤¯à¤¤à¤¿ à¤…à¤µà¤¿à¤¶à¥‡à¤·à¤¾à¤¤à¥, à¤µà¤¿à¤°à¥‹à¤§à¤¾à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¤¾à¤šà¥à¤š à¥¥
  10. Prakasavaccavaiyarthyat The Brahman is of these characteristics like the light, so that the scriptures will not be meaningless. ’ ; The scriptural text, Truth, knowledge, etc.’ (Tait. 1-2-1-1 ) is not devoid of meaning. Hence Brahman poss- esses the characteristic of knowledge, as He is self-luminous by nature. So also Brahman possesses the two-fold charac- teristics, namely, ’ being devoid of evils’ and ’ being possessed of good qualities’; because the following countless scriptural texts are not devoid of meaning-’ He is devoid of evils’ (Svet. VI. 19). He, who understands all and knows all (Mund. 1. 10). His supreme power is revealed, indeed, as varied and natural. And so are His knowledge, strength and activity’ (Svet. VI. 8). C
  11. Aha ca tanmatram And the text says that only. The scriptural text, Truth, knowledge etc’ (Tait. I-2-1-1) states only that His natural state is knowledge. It 34 à¥¨à¥¬à¥¬ à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤°: à¤¦à¤°à¥à¤¶à¤¯à¤¤à¤¿ à¤šà¤¾à¤¥à¥‹ à¤…à¤ªà¤¿ à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¥¥ à¥§à¥­ à¥¥ [ à¤…à¤§à¤¿. à¤¦à¤°à¥à¤¶à¤¯à¤¤à¤¿ à¤š à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¥‹à¤·à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤‚ à¤•à¤²à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤£à¤—à¥à¤£à¤¾à¤•à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤‚ à¤š à¤µà¥‡à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤—à¤£à¤ƒ " à¤¨à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤•à¤²à¤‚ à¤¨à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤•à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤‚ à¤¶à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤®à¥ " " à¤¤à¤®à¥€à¤¶à¥à¤µà¤°à¤¾à¤£à¤¾à¤‚ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤‚ à¤®à¤¹à¥‡à¤¶à¥à¤µà¤°à¤®à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤ƒ à¥¤ à¤¯à¥‹ à¤®à¤¾à¤®à¤œà¤®à¤¨à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤®à¥" à¤‡à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¤¾ à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¤š à¤¤à¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¤…à¤¤ à¤à¤µ à¤šà¥‹à¤ªà¤®à¤¾ à¤¸à¥‚à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤•à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤µà¤¤à¥ à¥¥ à¥§à¥® à¥¥ à¤¯à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤ªà¥ƒà¤¥à¤¿à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¥Œ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¤à¥à¤° à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¿à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤ªà¤¿ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¥‹à¤·à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤‚ à¤•à¤²à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤£à¤—à¥à¤£à¤¾à¤•à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤‚ does not exclude anything more, because there is no any reason for such a discrimination and there is no any contradiction.
  12. Darsayati catho api smaryate This is seen in the scriptures and also in the Smá¹›tis. The string of the scriptural texts shows that the Brahman is devoid of imperfections and is full of good qualities. The texts are ‘He is without parts, without activity, tranquil ’ (S’vet. VI. 19). ‘He is the Great and Supreme Lord of the lords’ (S’vet. VI. 7) etc. The Smrti text is this, â€“ ’ He, who knows Me unborn, beginningless etc.’ (Bhag. Gi. X. 3).
  13. Ata evacopamÄ sÅ«ryakÄdivat For this very reason, comparisons, such as reflected images of the sun and the like, are mentioned in the scriptures. The Brahman is devoid of evils and He is the mine of many good qualities, though He remains everywhere in the earth, etc. Hence in the following scriptures the " à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µà¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¿à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤ªà¤¿ A 1, à¤¶à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤®à¥ omitted M 3. 4] à¤¤à¥ƒà¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤¾à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¯à¥‡ à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤¤à¥€à¤¯à¤ƒ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¦à¤ƒ " à¥¨à¥¬à¥­ à¤š, à¤…à¤¤ à¤à¤µ à¤¶à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥‡à¤·à¥ ‘à¤œà¤²à¤¸à¥‚à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤•à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤µà¤¦à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¥à¤ªà¤®à¤¾, â€œ à¤†à¤•à¤¾à¤¶à¤®à¥‡à¤•à¤‚ à¤¹à¤¿ à¤¯à¤¥à¤¾ + à¤œà¤²à¤¾à¤§à¤¾à¤°à¥‡à¤·à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤µà¤¾à¤‚à¤¶à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¥ " à¤‡à¤¤à¤¿ à¥¥ à¤šà¥‹à¤¦à¤¯à¤¤à¤¿- à¤…à¤®à¥à¤¬à¥à¤µà¤¦à¤—à¥à¤°à¤¹à¤£à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥ à¤¨ à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤®à¥ à¥¥ à¥§à¥¯ à¥¥ à¤…à¤®à¥à¤¬à¥à¤¨à¤¿ à¤¸à¥‚à¤°à¥à¤¯à¥‹ à¤¯à¤¥à¤¾ à¤—à¥ƒà¤¹à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡, à¤¨ à¤¤à¤¥à¤¾ à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾ à¤ªà¥ƒà¤¥à¤¿à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¥Œ à¥¤ à¤…à¤¤à¥à¤° à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤¤à¤ƒ à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¿à¤¤à¤ƒ à¥¤ à¤…à¤¤à¥‹ à¤¨ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¦à¥‹à¤·à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿’ | à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤¹à¤°à¤¤à¤¿- à¤µà¥ƒà¤¦à¥à¤§à¤¿à¤¹à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¸ à¤­à¤¾à¤•à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤®à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤°à¥à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¤¾à¤¦à¥à¤­à¤¯à¤¸à¤¾à¤®à¤à¥à¤œà¤¸à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤‚ à¤¦à¤°à¥à¤¶à¤¨à¤¾à¤¥ à¥¥ à¥¨à¥¦ à¥¥ comparisons, such as reflected images of the sun in the water etc. are mentioned in the scriptures - Just as the ether, is one and the same without change even it becomes encased in the pots etc. and just as the sun reflected in water.’ (YÄjÃ±. Smr. PrÄ 144.) Then puts the following objection-
  14. AmbuvadagrahaÅ†at tu na tathatvam But the case is not so, because He is not apprehend- ed there like the sun in the water. The question here is this-The sun is apprehended as reflected in the waters. In the same way the Highest self is not apprehended in earth etc. But here He remains actually. Therefore He is not devoid of evils. Then refutes the objection-
